G718	ἁρμόζω	harmozō	to betroth	G:V	<b>ἁρμόζω</b> (&lt; ἁρμός), [in LXX for אמן, etc;] 1) to fit, join. 2) of marriage, to betroth. Mid, (a) <b>to join to oneself, marry, take to wife</b>; (b) to give in marriage: 2Co.11:2 (for this there is no direct parallel. But see M, <i>Pr.</i>, 160; MM, see word). (AS)
G719	ἁρμός	harmos	joint	G:N-M	<b>ἁρμός</b>, -ου, ὁ [in LXX: Sir.27:2, 4Ma.10:5 *;] <b>a joining, joint</b>: Heb.4:12. (AS)
G720	ἀρνέομαι	arneomai	to deny	G:V	<b>ἀρνέομαι</b> -οῦμαι, depon, [in LXX: Gen.18:15 (כָּחַשׁ pi.), Wis.12:27 16:16 17:10, 4Ma.8:7 4Mac 10:15 *;] 1) to deny, say no, opp. to είπεῖν: absol, Mat.26:70, Luk.8:45; before ἅτι, 1Jn.2:22; with inf, Heb.11:24 2) In late Gk. (MM, see word), with accusative of person(s), <b>to deny, refuse to acknowledge, disown</b>: Act.3:14 7:35; Ἰησοῦν, Mat.10:33, 2Ti.2:12, 1Jn.2:22, Ju 4; ἑαυτόν, Luk.9:23, 2Ti.2:13 (prove false to) 3) C. accusative of thing(s) (in cl. to refuse), <b>to deny, abjure</b>: 1Ti.5:8, Tit.2:12, 2Ti.3:5 (cf. ἀπαρνέομαι) (AS)
G721	ἀρνίον	arnion	lamb	G:N-N	<b>ἀρνίον</b>, -ου, τό (dimin. of ἀρήν; see MM, see word), [in LXX: Psa.114:4, 6 (pl, צֹאן בֵּן), Jer.11:19 (כֶּבֶשׂ), Jer.50:45 (צָעִיר)*;] <b>a little lamb, a lamb</b>: Jhn.21:15, Rev.2:7. (AS)
G722	ἀροτριάω	arotriaō	to plow	G:V	<b>ἀροτριάω</b>, -ῶ (&lt; ἄροτρον), [in LXX: Deu.22:10, al. (חָרַשׁ), Isa.7:25 (עֲדַר);] <b>later form of ἀρόω, to plough </b>(MM, see word): Luk.17:7, 1Co.9:10. (AS)
G723	ἄροτρον	arotron	plow	G:N-N	<b>ἄροτρον</b>, -ου, τό (&lt; ἀρόω, to plough), [in LXX chiefly for אֵת;] <b>a plough</b>: Luk.9:62. (AS)
G724	ἁρπαγή	harpagē	plunder	G:N-F	<b>ἁρπαγή</b>, -ῆς, ἡ (&lt; ἁρπάζω), [in LXX (as also ἅρπαγμα) for גָּזֵל, etc;] <b>pillage, plundering, robbery</b>: Mat.23:25, Luk.11:39, Heb.10:34. (AS)
G725	ἁρπαγμός	harpagmos	something to grasp	G:N-M	<b>ἁρπαγμός</b>, οῦ, ὁ (&lt; ἁρπάζω); 1) prop, accusative, to the rule of its formation (Bl, § 27, 2), actively, the act of seizing, robbery (Plut, Deu Puer. Educ, p. 12A), Php.2:6, AV (Waterland, Works, II, 108; Cremer, 649 f; Meyer, in l; cf. also JThS, July, 1909, April, 1911; MM, see word). 2) Passively = ἅρπαγμα (Eze.22:25, of a lion's prey,), <b>a thing seized, hence, a prize</b>: Phi, l.with, RV (Lft, Ellic, <i>ICC</i>, in l; Donaldson, NCrat, 450 ff; and esp. Gifford, The Incarnation, 59-71, and reff. in <i>DB</i>, ii, 835 B). The lexical data favour the active meaning, but as they also admit the possibility of the alternative, most modern expositors have accepted the latter as seeming to suit the logic of the passage better. The lexical difficulty, however, remains (MM, see word, esp. the last ref.). As to the usage of St. Paul, he seems inclined to adopt the -μα form where it is appropriate (e.g. Rom.11:9, where cf. LXX; 1Co.13:9, 2 Co 19), and there is certainly a presumption in favour of the active meaning here from the fact that he does not use the LXX ἅρπαγμα. Suggestions looking to a fresh exegesis are given in JThS, ll with (AS)

(AS)

G728	ἀρραβών	arrabōn	guarantee	G:N-M	<b>ἀρραβών</b> (T, ἀραβ: 2Co, ll. with), -ώνος, ὁ, [in LXX: Gen.38:17-20 (עֲרָבוֹן)*;] <b>an earnest, part payment in advance for security, a first instalment</b>: 2Co.1:22 5:5, Eph.1:14. (The word is found in cl. and was prob. brought to Greece by the Phænicians (AR, <i>Eph.</i>, l.with). It is found in π. with both spellings (see Milligan, <i>NTD</i>, 73). G846	αὐτός	autos	he/she/it/self	G:PerP	<b>αὐτός</b>, -ή, -ό, <i>determinative pron.</i>, in late Gk. much more freq. than in cl. (WM, 178f; Jannaris, <i>HGG</i>, §1399). 1) Emphatic (so always in nom. exc. when preceded by the art, see infr, iii); (1) <b>self</b> (ipse), expressing opposition, distinction, exclusion, etc, αὐ. ἐκχυθήσεται, Luk.5:37; αὐ. ἐγινώσκεν, Jhn.2:25; αὐ.ὑμεῖς, Jhn.3:28; καὶ αὐ. ἐγώ, Rom.15:14; αὐ. Ἰησοῦς, Jhn.2:24; αὐ. καὶ οἱ μετ᾽ αὐτοῦ, Mrk.2:25; ὑμεῖς αὐ, Mrk.6:31; esp. (as freq in cl.) αὐ. ὁ, Mat.3:4, Mrk.6:17, Jhn.16:27, 1Th.3:11, al; in late Gk, sometimes weakened, ἐν αὐτῇ τ. ὥρᾳ, <b>in that hour</b>, Luk.10:21 (M, <i>Pr.</i>, 91; MM, see word); (2) emphatic, <b>he, she, it</b> (M, <i>Pr.</i>, 86; Bl, §48, 1, 2, 7), Mat.1:21, 12:50, Luk.6:35, al; pointing to some one as master (cl.), Mat.8:24, Mrk.4:38, al; αὐ, καὶ αὐ. = οὗτος, ὁ δε (BL, §48, 1), Mat.14:2, Mrk.14:15, 44, Luk.1:22, 2:28, al. 2) In oblique cases (cl.), for the simple pron. of 3rd of person(s), <b>he, she, it</b>, Mat.7:9, 10:12, 26:44, al; with ptcp. in genitive absol, Mat.9:18, Mrk.13:1, al. (for irreg. constructions, V. Bl, §74, 5); pleonastically after the relative (cf. Heb. אֲשֶׁר לוֹ; WM, 184ff; Bl, §50, 4; MM, see word), Mrk.7:25, Rev.3:8, 7:2, al; in constr. ad sensum, without proper subject expressly indicated, Mat.4:23, Act.8:5, 2Co.2:13, al; genitive αὐτοῦ = ἐκείνου, Rom.11:11, 1Th.2:19, Tit.3:5, Heb.2:4. 3) ὁ, ἡ, τὸ αὐ, <b>the same</b>: Heb.1:12, 13:8; τὸ αὐ, ποιεῖν, Mat.5:46, 47, al; φρονεῖν, Rom.12:16, 15:5, Php.2:2, al; τὰ αὐ, Act.15:27, Rom.2:1, al; κατὰ τὸ (τὰ) αὐ. (MM, see word), Act.14:1, Luk.6:23, al; ἐπὶ τὸ αὐ, <b>together</b> (MM, see word), Mat.22:34, Act.1:15, al; ἓν κ. τὸ αὐ, 1Co.11:5, 12:11; with dative (cl.), 1Co.11:5; with a noun, λόγος, Mrk.14:39; μέτρος, Php.1:30; πνεῦμα, 1Co.12:4. G873	ἀφορίζω	aphorizō	to separate	G:V	<b>ἀφ-ορίζω </b> [in LXX (Cremer, 805 f.) for בָּדַל hi, סָגַר hi, נוּף hi, רוּם hi etc;] (a) <b>to mark off by boundaries from, separate from</b>: with accusative, Act.19:9, Gal.2:12; id. before ἐκ (ἀπό), Mat.13:49 25:32 (MM, see word); of excom­munication, Luk.6:22. G874	ἀφορμή	aphormē	opportunity	G:N-F	<b>ἀφ-ορμή</b>, -ῆς, ἡ [in LXX: Eze.5:7 (הָמוֹן), Pro.9:9, 3Ma.3:2 *;] prop, a starting point; in war, a base of operations; metaph, <b>an occasion, incentive, opportunity </b>(MM, see word): 2Co.11:12, Gal.5:13; ἀφ. λαμβάνειν, Luk.11:24, WH, mg, Rom.7:8, 11; ἀφ. διδόναι, 2Co.5:12, 1Ti.5:14.* (AS)

G876	ἀφρός	aphros	foam	G:N-M	<b>foam </b>, of the sea, (Iliad by Homer): of an angry lion, <b>foam, froth </b>, (Iliad by Homer); ἀπ᾽ ἀνθρώπων ἀφρόν <b>frothy blood </b>, (Aeschulus Tragicus) (ML)

G878	ἄφρων	aphrōn	foolish	G:A	<b>ἄφρων</b>, -ον genitive -ονος (&lt; φρήν), [in LXX for כְּסִיל, נָבָל, etc;] <b>without reason, senseless, foolish, expressing "want of mental sanity and sobriety, a reckless and inconsiderate habit of mind" </b>(Hort; cf. G891	ἄχρι	achri	until	G:Prep	<b>ἄχρι</b> (and Epic ἄχρις, bef. vowel (see MM, see word), Rom.11:25 T, Gal.3:19 T, WH, mg, Heb.3:13); 1) adv, utterly (Hom.). 2) Prep. with genitive, until, unto, as far as; (a) of time Act.3:21 22:22, Rom.1:13 5:13, 1Co.4:11, 2Co.3:14, Gal.4:2, Php.1:6; ἄ. καιροῦ, Luk.4:13, Act.13:11; ἄ. ἧς ἡμέρας, Mat.24:38, Luk.1:20 17:27, Act.1:2 (τῆς ἡ. ἧς), Act.1:22; ἄ. ταύτης τ. ἡμέρας (τ. ἡ. ταύτης), Act.2:29 23:1 26:22; ἄ. ἡμερων πέντε, Act.20:6; ἄ. αὐγῆς, Act.20:11; ἄ. τοῦ νῦν, Rom.8:22, Php.1:5; ἄ. τέλους, Heb.6:11, Rev.2:26; (b) <b>of space</b>: Act.11:5 13:6 20:4 (R, txt, WH, mg.) (Bl, ut supr.), Luk.21:24, Rom.11:25, 1Co.11:26 15:25, Gal.3:19, T, WH, mg; id. with ἄν, Rev.2:25; with indic. pres, while, Heb.3:13 (cf. μέχρι). (AS)

G896	Βάαλ	Baal	Baal	N:N--T	<b>Βάαλ</b> (Rec. βαάλ), ὁ, ἡ, indecl. (Heb. בַּעַל, <b>lord</b>), <b>Baal</b>: Rom.11:4 (LXX). The fem. art. here agrees with the usage of LXX, where, following a similar Hebrew practice (בֹּשֶׁת for בַּעַל), αἰσχύνη appears to have been substituted in reading for the written Βάαλ (cf. 3Ki.18:19), and to account for the freq. use of the fem. art. bef. Β. The usage, however, is not general, and in the passage cited in Ro (3Ki.19:18), LXX reads τῷ Β. (AS)

G907	βαπτίζω	baptizō	to baptize	G:V	<b>βαπτίζω</b> (&lt; βάπτω), [in LXX: 4Ki.5:14 (טבל), Isa.21:4, Jdth.12:7, Sir.31 (34)30 *;] <b>to dip, immerse, sink</b>; 1) generally (in Polyb, iii, 72, of soldiers <b>wading breast-deep</b>; in i, 51, of the <b>sinking</b> of ships); metaph, <b>to overwhelm</b> (Is, l.with; cf. Mid, 2) <b>to perform ablutions, wash oneself, bathe</b> (Ki, Jth, Si, ll. with): Mrk.7:4; aor. pass, in same sense, Luk.11:38. 3 Of ablution, immersion, as a religious rite, <b>to baptize</b>; (a) (a) absol; Mrk.1:4, Jhn.1:25, 26 28 3:22, 23, 26 4:2 10:40, 1Co.1:17; ὁ βαπτίζων (= ὁ βαπτιστής, M, <i>Pr.</i>, 127), Mrk.6:14, 24; with accusative, Jhn.4:1, Act.8:38, I Co.1.14, 16; with cogn. accusative, τὸ βάπτισμα, Act.19:4 (cf. Mrk.10:38, supr.); pass, <b>to be baptized, receive baptism</b>: Mat.3:13, 14, 16, Mrk.16:16, Luk.3:7, 12 21 7:29 (τ. βάπτισμα) ib. 30, Act.2:41 8:12, 13 36 9:18 10:47 16:15, 33 18:8; mid, 22:16 (M, <i>Pr,</i> 163); (b) <b>with prepositions</b>: ἐν, of the element, Mat.3:6, 11 Mrk.1:4, 5 8, Luk.3:16, Jhn.1:26, 31 33 3:23, Act.1:5 2:38 10:48 11:16, 1Co.10:2; εἰς, of the element, purpose or result (Lft, <i>Notes</i>, 155), Mat.3:1 28:19, Mrk.1:9, Act.8:16 19:3, 5 Rom.6:3, 1Co.1:13, 15 10:2 12:13, Gal.3:27; with dative, ὕδατι, Luk.3:16, Act.1:5 11:16; ὑπὲρ τῶν νεκρῶν, perh. to fulfil the wish of a dead friend, 1Co.15:29 (see <i>ICC</i>, in l; cf. <i>DB</i>, i, 238ff; <i>DCG</i>, i, 169a; ii, 605b; Cremer, 126). (AS)
G908	βάπτισμα	baptisma	baptism	G:N-N	<b>βάπτισμα</b>, -τος, τό (&lt; βαπτίζω), prop, the result of the act, τὸ βαπτίζειν, as distinct from βαπτισμός, the act itself, <b>immersion, baptism</b>; 1) metaph, of affliction: Mrk.10:38, 39 Luk.12:50. 2) <b>Of the religious rite of baptism</b>; (a) <b>of John's baptism</b>: Mat.3:7 21:25, Mrk.11:30, Luk.7:29 20:4, Act.1:22 10:37 18:25 19:3; β. μετανοίας, Mrk.1:4, Luk.3:3, Act.13:24 19:4; (b) <b>of Christian baptism</b>; Rom.6:4, Eph.4:5, Col.2:12 (Tr, -μῷ, which see), 1Pe.3:21 (cf. G909	βαπτισμός	baptismos	baptism	G:N-M	<b>βαπτισμός</b>, -οῦ, ὁ (&lt; βαπτίζω), prop, the act of which βάπτισμα is the result; 1) <b>a dipping, washing, lustration</b>: Mrk.7:4; of Jewish ceremonial. Heb.9:10; in Heb.6:2, βαπτισμῶν διδαχήν (-ῆς), "the pl. and the peculiar form seem to be used to include Christian baptism with other lustral rites" (Westc, in l.). 2) <b>baptism</b>: FlJ, Ant, 18, 5, 2 (of John's baptism), and some Fathers (see Soph, see word). Not so in NT, unless ἐν τ. βαπτισμῷ, <i>in the act of baptism</i>, Col.2:12, be read with Tr. (Rec, WH, R, -ματι). (AS)

G920	Βαριωνᾶς	Bariōnas	son of Jonas	N:N-M-P	<b>Βαριωνᾶς</b>, <b>Βαριωνᾶ</b>, -ᾶ, ὁ (Aram. בַּר־יוֹנָה, <b>son of Jonah</b>), <b>Bar-Jonah</b>, a surname of Peter: Mat.16:17. (AS)
G921	Βαρνάβας	Barnabas	Barnabas	N:N-M-P	<b>Βαρναβᾶς</b>, -α, ὁ (Aram. בַּר, <b>son</b>, as prefix to another word interpreted in Act.4:36, τῆς παρακλήσεως, perh. נְבוּאָה, wh, however, should be rendered by προφητεία as in II Est.6:14, LXX. Deiss, <i>BS</i>, 309f, thinks Β. may be a variant of the name Βαρνεβοῦς, <b>son of Nebo</b>, found in a Syrian Inscr, altered with a view to disguising its origin; see also Milligan, <i>NTD</i>, iii; Dalman, <i>Gr.</i>, 142), <b>Barnabas</b>: Act.4:36 9:27 11:22, 30 12:25 13-15, 1Co.9:6, Gal.2:1, 9 13, Col.4:10. (AS)
G922	βάρος	baros	burden	G:N-N	<b>βάρος</b>, -εος, τό, [in LXX: Jdg.18:21 (כּבד), Jdth.7:4, Sir.13:2, 2Ma.9:10, 3Ma.5:47 *;] <b>weight</b>; (a) <b>a weight, burden</b>, lit. and metaph: Mat.20:12, Act.15:28, 2Co.4:17, Rev.2:24; ἀλλήλων τὰ β, <b>one another's faults</b>, Gal.6:2; ἐν β, <b>burdensome</b>: 1Th.2:6, R, txt, but see infr; (b) in late Gk. (Soph, <i>Lex.</i>, see word), <b>dignity, authority</b>: ἐν βάρει, 1Th.2:6 (R, mg; see Milligan, <i>ICG</i>, in l.). (AS)
G923	Βαρσαβᾶς	Barsabas	Barsabbas	N:N-M-P	<b>Βαρσαββᾶς</b> (Rec. -αβᾶς), -ᾶ (Aram, <b>son of Sabba</b>), <b>Barsabbas</b>: 1) <b>the surname of one Joseph</b>: Act.1:23. 2) <b>The surname of one Judas</b>: Act.15:22. (AS)
G924	Βαρτιμαῖος	Bartimaios	Bartimaeus	N:N-M-P	<b>Βαρτίμαιος</b>, -ου, ὁ (-μαῖος, T; perh. Aram. בַּר־טִמְאַי, see <i>DB</i>, iv, p. 762), <b>Bartimæus</b>: Mrk.10:46. (AS)
G925	βαρύνω	barunō	to weigh down	G:V	<b>βαρύνω</b>, <b>to weigh down</b> = βαρέω (which see): Luk.21:34, Rec. (AS)
G926	βαρύς	barus	weighty	G:A	<b>βαρύς</b>, -εῖα, ύ, [in LXX chiefly for כָּבֵד;] <b>heavy</b>: Mat.23:4. Metaph, <b>burdensome</b>: ἐντολή, 1Jn.5:3; <b>severe</b> (perh. <b>impressive</b>): ἐπιστολή, 2Co.10:10; <b>weighty</b>: τὰ βαρύτερα τ. νόμου, Mat.23:23; αἰτιώματα, Act.25:7; <b>violent, cruel</b> (EV, <b>grievous</b>): λύκος, Act.20:29. (AS)
G927	βαρύτιμος	barutimos	expensive	G:A	<b>βαρύτιμος</b>, -ον (&lt; βαρύς, τιμή), <b>of great value, very costly</b>: Mat.26:7 (T, πολυτίμου). (AS)
G928	βασανίζω	basanizō	to torture	G:V	<b>βασανίζω</b> (&lt; βάσανος), [in LXX: 1Ki.5:3, Sir.4:17, and freq. in Wi, II, 4Mac;] 1) prop, <b>to rub on the touchstone, put to the test</b>. 2) <b>to examine by torture,</b> hence, generally, <b>to torture, torment, distress</b>: Mat.8:6, 29 14:24, Mrk.5:7 6:48, Luk.8:28, 2Pe.2:8, Rev.9:5 11:10 12:2 14:10 20:10. (AS)
G929	βασανισμός	basanismos	torment	G:N-M	<b>βασανισμός</b>, -οῦ, ὁ (&lt; βασανίζω), [in LXX: 4Ma.9:6 11:2 *;] <b>torture, torment</b>: Rev.9:5 14:11 18:7, 10, 15. (AS)
G930	βασανιστής	basanistēs	torturer	G:N-M	<b>βασανιστής</b>, -οῦ, ὁ (&lt; βασανίζω), prop, <b>a torturer</b>; used of a gaoler, Mat.18:34. (AS)
G931	βάσανος	basanos	torment	G:N-F	<b>βάσανος</b>, -ου, ὁ (of Oriental origin), [in LXX chiefly for כְּלִמָּה,אָשָׁם, and freq. in 4Mac;] 1) prop, <b>touchstone</b>, a dark stone used in testing metals. 2) <b>examination by torture</b>. 3) <b>torment, torture</b>: Mat.4:24, Luk.15:23, 28. (AS)
G932	βασιλεία	basileia	kingdom	G:N-F	<b>βασιλεία</b>, -ας, ἡ (&lt; βασιλεύω), [in LXX chiefly for מַמְלָכָה,מַלְכוּת;] 1) prop. abstract, <b>sovereignty, royal power, dominion</b>: Luk.1:33 22:29, Jhn.18:36, Act.1:6, Heb.1:8, 1Co.15:24; λαβεῖν β, Luk.19:12, 15 Rev.17:12; δοῦναι τὴν, ib. 17; ἔχειν β, ib. 18; ἔρχεσθαι ἐν τ. (εἰς τὴν) β, Mat.16:28, Luk.23:42; β. τ. θεοῦ, Rev.12:10. 2) By meton, concrete (MM, <i>Exp.</i>, x), (a) <b>a kingdom</b>, the territory or people over whom the king rules (Est.5:3, al.): Mat.4:8 12:25, 26 24:7, Mrk.3:24 6:23, Luk.4:5, Heb.11:33, al; (b) <b>the royal majesty</b> (cf. our phrase <i>His Majesty</i>), <b>the king</b> himself (τ. σπέρμα τῆς β, 4Ki.11:1). 3) In LXX (Wis.6:5, Tob.13:1, al.), Targ. and NT, of the Messianic rule and kingdom, ἡ β. τ. θεοῦ, τ. οὐρανῶν (Heb. מַלְכוּת שָׁמַיִם, Aram. מַלְכוּתָא דִשׁמַיָּא; see Dalman, <i>Words</i>, 91-147; Cremer, 132, 658), <b>the kingdom of God</b> (on the equivalence of the two phrases, see Dalman, <i>op. cit.</i>, 93, 218f.); τ. θεοῦ, Mat.6:33 12:28, al; τ. οὐρανῶν, Mat.3:2 4:17, al; τ. Χριστοῦ (מַלִכוּת דִמְשִׁיחא, Targ. Jon. on Isa.53:10), Eph.5:5; τ. κυρίου, 2Pe.1:11, Rev.11:15; τ. Δαυείδ, Mrk.11:10; absol, ἡ β, Mat.4:23, Jas.2:5, al. The kingdom is regarded as present: Mat.11:12, Luk.17:21, Rom.14:17, al; as that which is to be consummated in the future, Mat.6:10, Mrk.9:1, Jhn.3:5, 2Pe.1:11, al. Noteworthy phrases are: ζητεῖν τὴν β, Mat.6:33; δέχεσθαι, Mrk.10:15; κλρονομεῖν, Mat.25:34; διδόναι, Lk 12:32; παραλαμβάνειν, Heb.12:28; αὐτῶν (τοιούτων) εστὶν ἡ β, Mat.5:3, 10 19:14, Mrk.10:14, Luk.18:16; διὰ τὴν β, Mat.19:12; ἕνεκεν τῆς β, Luk.18:29; εὐαγγελίζεσθαι, κηρύσσειν, διαγγέλλειν τὴν β, Luk.4:43 9:2, 60; ἤγγικεν ἡ β, Mat.3:2, Mrk.1:15; κλεῖς τῆς β, Mat.16:10; κλείειν τὴν β, Mat.23:14; υἱοὶ τῆς β, Mat.8:12 13:38 (cf. Cremer, 132, 658). (AS)
G933	βασίλειον	basileion	palace	G:A	<b>βασίλειον</b>, -ου, τό (&lt; βασίλειος, which see), [in LXX for הֵיכָל (Nam.2:6, Dan.6:18 *), מַמְלָכָה (3Ki.3:1 14:8, 4Ki.15:19 *), etc;] 1) a <b>capital city</b>. 2) Freq. in pl, τὰ β, <b>a palace</b>: Luk.7:25. (AS)
G934	βασίλειος	basileios	kingly	G:A	<b>βασίλειος</b>, -ον (also -α, -ον; &lt; βασιλεύς), [in LXX; Exo.19:6, Deu.3:10 (מַמְלָכָה), Exo.23:22, Wis.18:15, 3Ma.3:28, 4Ma.3:8 *;] <b>royal</b>: 1Pe.2:9 (LXX) (see Hort, in l.). <b>royal, regal, kingly;</b>, <i>metaphoically</i> <b>possessed of high prerogatives and distinction,</b> 1Pet. 2:9; (AS)
G935	βασιλεύς	basileus	king	G:N-M	<b>βασιλεύς</b>, -έως, ὁ, [in LXX chiefly for מֶלֶךְ;] <b>a king</b>: Mat.1:6 2:1; used by courtesy of Herod the Tetrarch, Mat.14:9; of the Roman Emperor, as freq. in κοινή (Deiss, <i>LAE</i>, p. 367), 1Pe.2:13, 17; of the Christ, in the phrase ὁ β. τ. Ἰουδαίων, Mat.2:2, al; τοῦ Ἰσραήλ, Mrk.15:32, Jhn.1:50 12:13; of God, Mat.5:35, 1Ti.1:17, Rev.15:3; β. βασιλέων, Rev.17:14 19:16; β. τ. βασιλευόντων, 1Ti.6:15 (on the associations of the word to Jewish Hellenists, see <i>Cl. Rev.</i>, i, 7). (AS)
G936	βασιλεύω	basileuō	to reign	G:V	<b>βασιλεύω</b>, (&lt; βασιλεύς), [in LXX for מלךְ, its parts and derivatives, exc. 4Ki.15:5 (ישׁב);] <b>to be king, to reign, rule</b>: 1Ti.6:15; with genitive (cl.), Mat.2:22; before ἐπί, with accusative (= Heb. מלךְ על; Bl, §36, 8), Luk.1:33 19:14, 27 Rom.5:14; ἐπὶ τ. γῆς, <b>on earth</b>, Rev.5:10; of God, Rev.11:15, 17 19:6; of Christ, Luk.1:33, 1Co.15:25, Rev.11:15; of Christians, Rev.5:10 20:4 (constative aor, M, <i>Pr.</i>, 130), ib. 6 22:5. Metaph, Christians, Rom.5:17, 1Co.4:8; θάνατος, Rom.5:14, 17; ἁμαρτία, Rom.5:21 6:12. Ingressive aor. (M, <i>Pr.</i>, 109), <b>to begin to reign</b>: 1Co.4:8, Rev.11:17 19:6 (Cremer, 137). (AS)
G937	βασιλικός	basilikos	royal	G:A	<b>βασιλικός</b>, -ή, -όν (&lt; βασιλεύς), [in LXX for מֶלֶךְ and its cognates;] <b>royal, belonging to a king</b>: χώρα, Act 12:20; ἐσθής, Act.12:21; νόμος β, <b>a supreme law</b>, "a law which governs other laws and so has a specially regal character" (Hort), or because made by a king (<i>LAE</i>, p. 3673), Jas.2:8; τις, <b>one in the service of a king, a courtier</b>, Jhn.4:46, 49 (WH, mg, βασιλίσκος). (AS)
G938	βασίλισσα	basilissa	queen	G:N-F	<b>βασίλισσα</b>, -ης, ἡ (in Attic, βασιλεία, βασιλίς), [in LXX chiefly for מַלְכָּה;] <b>a queen</b>: Mat.12:42, Luk.11:31, Act.8:27, Rev.18:7. (AS)
G939	βάσις	basis	foot	G:N-F	<b>βάσις</b>, ־εως, ἡ (&lt; βαίνω), [in LXX chiefly for אֶדֶן;] 1) <b>a step</b> (Æsch, al.). 2) Hence, <b>a foot</b> (Plat; Wis.13:18): Act.3:7. (AS)

G941	βαστάζω	bastazō	to carry	G:V	<b>βαστάζω</b>, [in LXX: Jdg.16:30 (נטה), Rut.2:16, 2Ki.23:5, 4Ki.18:14 and Job.21:3 (נשׂא), Sir.6:25, Da TH Bel 36 *;] 1) <b>to take up</b> with the hands, <b>to lift</b>: λίθους, Jhn.10:31. 2) <b>to bear, to carry</b>, as a burden, and metaph, <b>to endure</b>; Mat.3:11 20:12, Mrk.14:13, Luk.7:14 10:7 11:27 14:27 22:10, Jhn.16:12 19:17, Act.3:2 9:15 15:1 21:35, Rom.11:18 15:1, Gal.5:10 6:2, 5 17, Rev.2:2, 3 17:7. 3) In late writers (MM, <i>Exp.</i>, ii, iii, x), (a) <b>to take away</b>; Mat.8:17 (Isa.53:4, Heb.); (b) <b>to carry off, steal</b>: Jhn.12:6 20:15. G942	βάτος	batos	thorn bush	G:N-F	<b>βάτος</b>, -ου, ὁ, ἡ, [in LXX (always masc, as in Attic): Exo.3:2-4, Deu.33:16 (סְנֶה), Job.31:40 (בָּאְשָׁה)*;] <b>a bramble-bush</b>: Luk.6:44, Act.7:30, 35; ἐπὶ τοῦ (τῆς) β, <b>in the place concerning the bush</b>: Mrk.12:26, Luk.20:37. (AS)
G943	βάτος	batos	bath	G:N-M	<b>βάτος</b>, -ου, ὁ (Heb. בַּת), [in LXX (also βαίθ, βάδος): II Est.7:22 *;] <b>bath</b>, a Jewish liquid measure, = μετρητής (which see), or about 8 3/4 gals: Luk.16:6. (AS)

G945	βαττολογέω	battologeō	to babble	G:V	<b>βατταλογέω</b>, -ῶ (Rec. βαττολ, D, βλαττ- = βατταρίζω, prob. onomatop; see MM, see word; <i>DCG</i>, ii, 499b, 790a); <b>to stammer, repeat idly</b>: Mat.6:7 (Cremer, 765). (AS)

G947	βδελυκτός	bdeluktos	abominable	G:A	<b>βδελυκτός</b>, ή, -όν (&lt; βδελύσσω), [in LXX: Pro.17:15 (תּוֹעֵבָה), Sir.41:5, 2Ma.1:27 *;] <b>abominable, detestable</b>: Tit.1:16 (Cremer, 137). (AS)
G948	βδελύσσομαι	bdelussomai	to abhor	G:V	<b>βδελύσσω</b>, <b>βδελύσσομαι</b> (&lt; βδέω, <b>to stink</b>), [in LXX chiefly for שׁקץ,תּעב;] in cl, mid. only (Attic, -ττομαι); <b>to make foul</b>; pass, Rev.21:8; mid, <b>to turn away in disgust from, to detest</b>: Rom.2:22 (Cremer, 137). (AS)
G949	βέβαιος	bebaios	firm	G:A	<b>βέβαιος</b>, -ον (also -α, -ον; &lt; βαίνω), [in LXX: Est.3:13, Wis.7:23, 3Ma.5:31 7:7, 4Ma.17:4 *;] <b>firm, secure</b>: ἄγκυρα, Heb.6:19; metaph, <b>sure</b> (esp. "in the sense of legally guaranteed security," Deiss, <i>BS</i>, 109; cf. two foll. words): ἐπαγγελία, Rom.4:16; ἐλπίς, 2Co.1:6; λόγος, Heb.2:2; παρρησία, Heb.3:6; ἀρχή (τ. ὑποστάσεως), Heb.3:14; διαθήκη, Heb.9:17; κλῆσις κ. ἐκλογή, 2Pe.1:10; comp. G950	βεβαιόω	bebaioō	to confirm	G:V	<b>βεβαιόω</b>, -ῶ (&lt; βέβαιος), [in LXX: Ps 40 (41)12 (נצב hi.), 118 (119)28 (קוּם pi.), 3Ma.5:42 *;] <b>to confirm, establish, secure</b>, of things (cl.): λόγον, Mk 16:[20]; ἐπαγγελίας, Rom.15:8; of persons (<i>DCG</i>, ii, 605): 1Co.1:8, 2Co.1:21. Pass, 1Co.1:6, Col.2:7, Heb.2:3 13:9 (as an Attic legal term, <b>to guarantee</b> the validity of a purchase, <b>establish</b> or <b>confirm</b> a title; see next word, Cremer, 139; cf. δια-β.). (AS)
G951	βεβαίωσις	bebaiōsis	confirmation	G:N-F	<b>βεβαίωσις</b>, -εως, ἡ (&lt; βεβαιόω, which see), [in LXX: Lev.25:23 (צְמִיתֻת), Wis.6:19 *;] <b>confirmation</b>: τ. εὐαγγελίου, Php.1:7; εἰς β, Heb.6:16, a phrase freq. in π. of guarantee in a business transaction (Deiss, <i>BS</i>, 104ff; Cremer, 140). (AS)
G952	βέβηλος	bebēlos	profane	G:A	<b>βέβηλος</b>, -ον (&lt; βαίνω, whence βηλός, <i>a threshold</i>), [in LXX chiefly for חֹל;] 1) <b>permitted to be trodden, accessible</b> (see <i>DCG</i>, ii, 422b); hence, 2) (opp. to ἱερός) <b>unhallowed, profane</b>: of things, 1Ti.4:7 6:20, 2Ti.2:16; of men, 1Ti.1:9, Heb.12:16 (cf. κοινός; Cremer, 140). (AS)
G953	βεβηλόω	bebēloō	to profane	G:V	<b>βεβηλόω</b>, -ῶ (&lt; βέβηλος), [in LXX chiefly for חלל;] <b>to profane</b>: τ. σάββατον, Mat.12:5; τ. ἱερόν, Act.24:6 (Cremer, 141). (AS)
G954	Βεελζεβούλ	Beelzeboul	Beelzebub	N:N--T	<b>Βεελζεβούλ</b> (WH, <i>App.</i>, 159, Rec, βεελζεβούλ), ὁ, indecl. (Heb. בַּעַל, <i>lord</i>, and the Talmudic זִבּוּל, from זֶבֶל, <i>dung</i> (Dalman, <i>Gr.</i>, 137.n), or perh. זִבֻל, <b>habitation</b>, but, see <i>DB</i>, iv, 409f; <i>DCG</i>, i, 181). The AV, RV, <b>Beelzebub</b>, comes through Vg. from 4Ki.1:2, בַּעַל זִבוּב, <b>lord of flies</b> (LXX, βάαλ μυῖα, Sm, βεελζεβούβ), <b>Beelzebul, Beelzebub</b>, a name of Satan: Mat.10:25 12:24, 27 Mrk.3:22, Luk.11:15, 18 19. (AS)
G955	Βελίαλ	Belial	Belial	N:N--T	<b>Βελίαλ</b>, ὁ, indecl. (Heb. בְּלִיַּעַל, <b>worthlessness</b>, but see <i>DB</i>, i, 268), <b>Belial</b>, a name of Satan: 2Co.6:15, Rec. See next word. <b>Βελιάρ</b>, ὁ, indecl. (another form of previous word, "due to harsh Syriac pronunciation," or else &lt; Heb. בֵּל יַעַר, <i>lord of the forest</i>), <b>Beliar</b>, a name of Satan: 2Co.6:15 (see <i>DB</i>, i, 269). (AS)
G956	βέλος	belos	arrow	G:N-N	<b>βέλος</b>, -εος, τό (&lt; βάλλω), [in LXX chiefly for חֵץ;] <b>a missile, a dart</b>: Eph.6:16. (AS)
G957	βελτίων	beltiōn	better	G:A	<b>βελτίων</b>, -ον (genitive -ονος), comp. of ἀγαθός, [in LXX chiefly for טוֹב;] neut. as <i>adv.</i>, <b>better, very well</b>: 2Ti.1:18 (also Act.10:28 D). On <i>elative</i> use in these passages, see M, <i>Pr.</i>, 78, 236. (AS)
G958	Βενιαμίν	Beniamin	Benjamin	N:N-M-P	<b>Βενιαμίν</b>, (Rec. -μίν), ὁ, indecl. (Heb. בֶּנְיָמִין), <b>Benjamin</b>: Act.13:21, Rom.11:1, Php.3:5, Rev.7:8. (AS)
G959	Βερνίκη	Bernikē	Bernice	N:N-F-P	<b>Βερνίκη</b> (elsewhere Βερενίκη), Macedonian form of Φερενίκη, cf. <i>Veronica, Victoria</i>), -ης, ἡ, <b>Bernice, Berenice</b>, dau. of Herod Agrippa I: Act.25:13, 23 26:3 o. (AS)
G960	Βέροια	Beroia	Berea	N:N--L	<b>Βέροια</b>, -ας, ἡ, <b>Berœa</b>, a city of Macedonia: Act.17:10, 13. (AS)
G961	Βεροιαῖος	Beroiaios	Berean	G:A	<b>Βεροιαῖος</b>, -α, -ον, <b>Berœan</b>: Act.20:4. (AS)
G962	Βηθαβαρά	Bēthabara	Bethabara	G:N-F	<b>Βηθαβαρά</b>, -ας (Rec. -ρᾶ, indecl; Heb. בֵּית עֲבָרָה, <i>place of crossing</i>; -αραβᾷ, R, mg.), <b>Bethabara</b>: Jhn.1:28, Rec. (WH, R, βηθανία). (AS)
G963	Βηθανία	Bēthania	Bethany	N:N-F-L	<b>Βηθανία</b>, -ας (also -ιά, indecl, Luk.19:29 and in B*, Mrk.11:1), ἡ, (Heb. בֵּית עֲנִיָּה, <i>house of affliction</i>, accusative to Jerome, or perh, <i>house of dates</i>, cf. <i>Bethphage</i>), <b>Bethany</b>; 1) <b>a village fifteen furlongs from Jerusalem, the modern El Azerîyeh</b>: Mat.21:17 26:6, Mrk.8:22 (WH, mg.) 11:1, 11, 12 14:3 Luk.19:29 24:50, Jhn.11:1, 18 12:1. 2) A place on E. bank of Jordan: Jhn.1:28 (R, mg, Βηθαβαρά, which see). (AS)
G964	Βηθεσδά	Bēthesda	Bethesda	N:N--L	<b>Βηθεσδά</b>, ἡ, indecl. (deriv. uncertain, see Westc. on Jhn.5:2, and <i>DB</i>, i, 279), <b>Bethesda</b>, <b>a pool in Jerusalem</b>: Jhn.5:2, Rec. (Βηθζαθά, WH, Βηθσαϊδά, WH, mg.). (AS)
G965	Βηθλεέμ	Bēthleem	Bethlehem	N:N--L	<b>Βηθλέεμ</b>, ἡ, indecl. (Heb. בֵּית לֶחֶם, <i>house of bread</i>), <b>Bethlehem</b>, a town 6 m. S. of Jerusalem: Mat.2:1, 5 6, 8, 16, Luk.2:4, 15 Jhn.7:42. (AS)
G966	Βηθσαϊδά, Βηθζαθά	Bēthsaida	Bethsaida	N:N--L	<b>Βηθσαιδά</b> (Rec. -σαϊδά), and -δάν (Mt, Mk, ll. with), ἡ, indecl. (Syr, <i>house of fish</i>), <b>Bethsaida</b>, a town on NE. shore of the Sea of Galilee: Luk.9:10. It is generally supposed that a second B. on the W. shore is referred to in Mat.11:21, Mrk.6:45 8:22, Luk.10:13, Jhn.1:45 12:21 (<i>DB</i>, i, 282f; but see Swete on Mrk.6:45). 2) 2. <b> Βηθζαθά</b>, ἡ, indecl. (perh. Aram. בֵּית זַיְתָה, <i>house of olives</i>) Jhn.5:2. (AS)
G967	Βηθφαγή	Bēthphagē	Bethphage	N:N--L	<b>Βηθφαγή</b> (L, -γῆ), ἡ, indecl. (Aram. בֵּית־פַּגֵּי, <i>house of unripe figs</i>; Dalman, <i>Gr.</i>, 191), <b>Bethphage</b>: Mat.21:1, Mrk.11:1, Luk.19:29. (AS)
G968	βῆμα	bēma	judgement seat	G:N-N	<b>βῆμα</b>, -τος, τό (&lt; βαίνω), [in LXX: Deu.2:5 (מִדְרָךְ), Neh.8:4 (מִגְדָּל), I Est.9:42, Sir.19:30 45:9, 2Ma.13:26 *;] 1) <b>a step, stride, pace</b>: Act.7:5. 2) <b>a raised place, a platform</b> reached by steps, originally that in the Pnyx at Athens from which orations were made; freq. of the <b>tribune</b> or <b>tribunal</b> of a Roman magistrate or ruler: Mat.27:19, Jhn.19:13, Act.12:21, 18:12, 16, 17 25:6, 10, 17; β. τοῦ θεοῦ, Rom.14:10; τ. Χριστοῦ, 2Co.5:10. (AS)
G969	βήρυλλος	bērullos	beryl	G:N-M	<b>βήρυλλος</b>, -ου, ὁ, ἡ, [in LXX: Tob.13:17 (-ύλλιον in Exo.28:20, שֹׁהַם *;] <b>beryl</b>, a jewel of sea-green colour: Rev.21:20. (AS)
G970	βία	bia	force	G:N-F	<b>βία</b>, -ας, ἡ, [in LXX for פֶּרֶךְ, etc;] <b>strength, force, violence</b>: Act.5:26 21:35 24:7 27:41. (AS)
G971	βιάζω	biazō	to force	G:V	<b>βιάζω</b> (&lt; βία), and depon. -ομαι, [in LXX for פּרץ, פּצר, etc;] <b>to force, constrain</b>, rare in act. (poet, and late prose), but found in cl. in pass, and so perh. βιάζεται, <b>suffereth violence</b>, Mat.11:12, EV (but see infr.), whether (a) in good sense, of disciples (Thayer, al.), or (b) in bad sense, of the enemies of the kingdom (Meyer, in l; Dalman, <i>Words</i>, 139ff; Cremer, 141ff.). Mid, <b>advanceth violently</b>, Mt, l.with (Deiss, <i>BS</i>, 258; Banks, see ref. in DCG, ii, 803f.); before εἰς, <b>to press violently</b>, or <b>force one's way into</b>, Luk.16:16 (see <i>ICC</i>, in l, and in Mt, l.with; cf. παραβιάζομαι and see MM, see word). (AS)
G972	βίαιος	biaios	strong	G:A	<b>βίαιος</b>, -α, -ον (&lt; βία), [in LXX for אָנַשׁ, עַז, צַר, etc;] <b>violent</b>: Act.2:2. (AS)
G973	βιαστής	biastēs	forceful person	G:N-M	<b>βιαστής</b>, -οῦ, ὁ (&lt; βιάζω), late form of βιατάς; 1) <b>strong, forceful</b>. 2) <b>violent</b> (Philo): Mat.11:12 (see: βιάζω). (AS)
G974	βιβλαρίδιον	biblaridion	little scroll	G:N-N	<b>βιβλαρίδιον</b>, -ου, τό (dim. of βιβλάριον, dim. of βίβλος), <b>a little book</b>: Rev.10:2, 8 (WH, βιβλιόν, T2, 7 βιβλιδάριον) 9, 10. Not hitherto found elsewhere. (AS)
G975	βιβλίον	biblion	scroll	G:N-N	<b>βιβλίον</b>, -ου, τό (dim. of βίβλος, which see), [in LXX also in the alternat. form βυβ, chiefly for סֶפֶר and the most freq. of the cognate forms;] 1) <b>a paper, letter, written document</b>: β. ἀποστασίου, <b>bill of divorce</b>, Mat.19:7, Mrk.10:4. 2) <b>a book, a roll</b>: Luk.4:17, 20 Jhn.20:30 21:25, Gal.3:10, 2Ti.4:13, Heb.9:19 10:7, Rev.1:11 5:1-9 6:14 10:8 20:12 22:7-19; β. τ. ζωῆς, Rev.13:8 17:8 20:12 21:27. (AS)
G976	βίβλος	biblos	book	G:N-F	<b>βίβλος</b>, -ου, ἡ (variant form of βύβλος, the Egyptian <i>papyrus</i>, paper made from its fibrous coat), [in LXX for סֶפֶר, the form βύβ- being sometimes used;] <b>a book, a roll</b>, used much less freq. than βιβλίον, and with a "connotation of sacredness and veneration" (MM, <i>Exp.</i>, x), Mat.1:1 Mrk.12:26, Luk.3:4 20:42 Act.1:20 7:42 19:19; β. τ. ζωῆς, Php.4:3, Rev.3:5 20:15. (AS)

G987	βλασφημέω	blasphēmeō	to blaspheme	G:V	<b>βλασφημέω</b>, -ῶ (&lt; βλάσφημος), [in LXX: 4Ki.19:4 (יכח hi.) ib. 6, 22 (גּדף pi.), Isa.52:5 (נאץ hith.), Dan LXX 3:29 (96) (אמר שׁלח), Tob.1:18, Da TH Bel 9, 2Ma.2 *;] 1) <b>to speak lightly or profanely of sacred things</b> (in cl, opp. of εὐφημέω), esp. <b>to speak impiously of God, to blaspheme, speak blasphemously</b>: absol, Mat.9:3 26:65, Mrk.2:7, Jhn.10:36, Act.26:11, 1Ti.1:20, 2Pe.2:12; τ. θεόν, Act.19:37, Rev.16:11, 21; τὸ ὄνομα τ. θεοῦ, Rev.13:6 16:9; δόξας, Ju 3, 2Pe.2:10; εἰς τὸ πνεῦμα τὸ πνεῦμα τὸ ἅγιον, Mrk.3:29, Luk.12:10. 2) <b>to revile, rail at, slander</b>: absol, Luk.22:65, Act.13:45 18:6, 1Pe.4:4; with accusative, Mat.27:39, Mrk.3:28 15:29, Luk.23:39, Tit.3:2, Jas.2:7, Ju 10. G988	βλασφημία	blasphēmia	blasphemy	G:N-F	<b>βλασφημία</b>, -ας, ἡ (&lt; βλάσφημος), [in LXX: Eze.35:12 (נֶאָצָה), Da TH 3:29 (96) (שׁלה), Tob.1:18, 1Ma.2:6, 2Ma.8:4 10:35 15:24 *;] (a) <b>railing slander</b>: Mat.12:31 15:19, Mrk.3:28 7:22, Eph.4:31, Col.3:8, 1Ti.6:4, Ju 9, Rev.2:9 (b) spec, <b>impious speech against God, blasphemy</b>: Mat.26:65, Mrk.14:64, Luk.5:21, Jhn.10:33, Rev.13:5; ὄνομα βλασφημίας, Rev.13:1 17:3; with genitive obj. Mat.12:31; πρὸς τ. θεόν, Rev.13:6 (Cremer, 570; <i>DB</i>, i, 305; <i>DCG</i> ii, 423). (AS)
G989	βλάσφημος	blasphēmos	blasphemous	G:A	<b>βλάσφημος</b>, -ον (&lt; βλασ, of uncertain deriv, see Thayer, Boisacq; + φήμη, speech), [in LXX: Isa.66:3 (מְבָרֵךְ אָוֶן), Wis.1:6, Sir.3:16, 2Ma.9:28 10:4, 36 *;] (a) <b>evil-speaking, slanderous, blasphemous</b>: Act.6:11, 2Ti.3:2, 2Pe.2:11 (cf. G990	βλέμμα	blemma	a look	G:N-N	<b>βλέμμα</b>, -τος, τό (&lt; βλέπω), <b>a look, a glance</b>: βλέμματι καὶ ἀκοῇ, 2Pe.2:8, <b>sight and hearing</b>, a sense not found for β. in Gk. lit, but perh. recognized in the vernacular (<b>ICC</b>, in l.) (AS)
G991	βλέπω	blepō	to see	G:V	<b>βλέπω</b>, [in LXX chiefly for ראה, also for פּנה, etc;] 1) <b>of bodily sight</b>; (a) <b>to see, have sight</b> (opp. to τυφλὸς): Mat.12:22, Jhn.9:7, Act.9:9, Rom.11:8, Rev.3:18, al; (b) <b>to perceive, look (at), see</b>: absol, Act.1:9; with accusative, Mat.7:3, Mrk.5:31, Luk.6:41, Jhn.1:29, al; ὅραμα, Act.12:9; γυναῖκα, Mat.5:28; βιβλίον, Rev.5:3, 4; τ. βλεπόμενα, 2Co.4:18. 2) Metaph, of mental vision; (a) <b>to see, perceive, discern</b>: absol, Mat.13:13, Luk.8:10; δι ̓ ἐσόπτρου, 1Co.13:12; with accusative, Heb.2:9 10:25; before ὅτι, Heb.3:19, Jas.2:22; (b) <b>to consider, look to, take heed</b>: absol, Mrk.13:23, 33; with accusative, 1Co.1:26, al; before πῶς, with indic, Luk.8:18, 1Co.3:10, Eph.5:15; before τί, with indic, Mrk.4:24; before εἰς πρόσωπον, of partiality, Mat.22:16, Mrk.12:14. Colloq. (for ex. from π, V. Deiss, <i>LAE</i>, 122; M, <i>Pr.</i>, 107; MM, <i>Exp.</i>, x; Milligan, <i>NTD</i>, 50), β. ἑαυτόν: Mrk.13:9; before ἵνα μή, II Jo 8; β. ἀπό, Mrk.8:15 12:38; before μή (cl. ὁρᾶν), with fut. indic, Col.2:8, Heb.3:12; id. with aor. subj, Mat.24:4, Mrk.13:5. 3) Of situation and direction (Lat. specto), <b>to look, face</b> (towards), places, etc. (before πρός, Xen, <i>Hell.</i>, vii, 1, 17; Eze.40:23, 24): before κατά, with accusative, Act.27:12 (cf. ἀνα, ἀπο, δια, ἐμ, ἐπι, περ, προ-βλέπω), see <i>DCG</i>, i, 446; ii, 596. (AS)

G1010	βουλευτής	bouleutēs	member of a council	G:N-M	<b>βουλευτής</b>, -οῦ, ὁ (&lt; βουλεύω), [in LXX: Job.3:14 12:17 (יעץ)*;] <b>a councillor, a senator</b>; of a member of the Sanhedrin: Mrk.15:34, Luk.23:50. (AS)
G1011	βουλεύω	bouleuō	to plan	G:V	<b>βουλεύω</b> (&lt; βουλή), [in LXX chiefly for יעץ;] <b>to take counsel, deliberate, resolve</b>. G1012	βουλή	boulē	plan	G:N-F	<b>βουλή</b>, -ῆς, ἡ (&lt; βούλομαι), [in LXX freq. for עֵצָה;] <b>counsel, purpose</b> (in cl, esp. of the gods): Luk.23:51, Act.4:28 5:38 19:1 27:12, 42; pl, 1Co.4:5; of the Divine purpose, Heb.6:17; τ. βουλὴν τ. θελήματος αὐτοῦ, Eph.1:11; β. τ. Θεοῦ, Luk.7:30, Act.2:23 13:36 20:27. (AS)
G1013	βούλημα	boulēma	plan	G:N-N	<b>βούλημα</b>, -τος, τό (&lt; βούλομαι), [in LXX: Pro.9:10 (דַּעַת), 2Ma.15:5, 4Ma.8:18 *;] <b>purpose, will</b>: Act.27:43, Rom.9:19, 1Pe.4:3. (AS)
G1014	βούλομαι	boulomai	to plan	G:V	<b>βούλομαι</b>, [in LXX for חפץ, אבה, יעץ, etc;] <b>to will, wish, desire, purpose, be minded</b>, implying more strongly than θέλω (which see), the deliberate exercise of volition (see Hort on Jas.1:18): with inf. (M, <i>Pr.</i>, 205; Bl, §69, 4), Mrk.15:15, Act.5:28, 33 12:4 15:37 17:20 18:15, 27 19:30 22:30 23:28 27:43 28:18, 2Co.1:15, 1Ti.6:9, Heb.6:17, II Jhn.12, 3Jo.10, Ju 5; with accusative, 2Co.1:17; with accusative and inf, Php.1:12, 1Ti.2:8 5:14, Tit.3:8, 2Pe.3:9; of the will making choice between alternatives, Mat.1:19 11:27, Luk.10:22, Act.25:20, 1Co.12:11, Jas.3:4 4:4; εἰ βούλει (cl, a courteous phrase = θέλεις, colloq; Bl, §21, 8; LS, see word), Luk.22:42; with subjc, adding force to a question of deliberation (Bl, §64, 6), Jhn.18:39; βουληθείς, <b>of set purpose</b> (see Hort, in l.), Jas.1:18; impf, ἐβουλόμην (= cl. βουλοίμην ἄν; Bl, §63, 5; Lft, <i>Phm.</i> 13), Act.25:22, Phm 13 (see also Cremer, 143). (AS)

G1018	βραβεύω	brabeuō	to rule	G:V	<b>βραβεύω</b> (&lt; βραβεύς, <i>an umpire</i>), [in LXX: Wis.10:12 *;] (a) prop, <b>to act as umpire</b>; hence, (b) generally, <b>to arbitrate, decide</b> (Isocr, Dem; Lft, <i>Col.</i>, l.with; MM, see word): Col.3:15; (with) in some late writers, <b>to direct, rule, control</b> (so in Col, l.with, accusative to Thayer, see word, Meyer, in l.), (cf. κατα-βραβεύω). G1059	Γαμαλιήλ	Gamaliēl	Gamaliel	N:N-M-P	<b>Γαμαλιήλ</b>, ὁ (Heb. גַּמְלִיאֵל), <b>Gamaliel</b> the elder, a Pharisee and Doctor of the Law: Act.5:34 22:3. (AS)
G1060	γαμέω	gameō	to marry	G:V	<b>γαμέω</b>, -ῶ, [in LXX: Est.10:3, 2Ma.14:25, 4Ma.16:9 *;] <b>to marry</b>; 1) of the man, <b>to marry, take to wife</b> (ducere): absol, Mat.19:10 22:25, 30 24:38, Mrk.12:25, Luk.17:27, 20:34, 35, 1Co.7:28, 33; with accusative: Mat.5:32 19:9, Mrk.6:17 10:11, Luk.14:20 16:18. 2) Of the woman, (a) mid. (and in late writers, pass.), <b>to give oneself in marriage, marry</b> (nubere): 1Co.7:39; (b) in Hellenistic (M, <i>Pr.</i>, 159), act. (as of the man), <b>to marry</b>: absol, 1Co.7:28, 34 1Ti.5:11, 14. with accusative, Mrk.10:12. 3) <b>Of both sexes</b>: absol, 1Ti.4:3, 1Co.7:9, 10 36. (AS)
G1061	γαμίσκω, γαμίζω	gamiskō, gamizō	to give in marriage	G:V	<b>γαμίζω</b> (&lt; γάμος), <b>to give in marriage</b>, <b>a daughter</b>: 1Co.7:38. Pass, Mat.22:30 24:38, Mrk.12:25, Luk.17:27 20:35 (WH, mg, γαμίσκονται; cf. γαμίζω). (AS)
G1062	γάμος	gamos	wedding	G:N-M	<b>γάμος</b>, -ου, ὁ, [in LXX for מִשְׁתֶּה;] 1) <b>a wedding</b>, esp. <b>a wedding-feast</b>: Mat.22:8, 10 11, 12, Jhn.2:1-3, Rev.19:7, 9; pl. (Field, <i>Notes</i>, 16), Mat.22:2-4, 9 25:10, Luk.12:36 14:8. 2) <b>marriage</b>: Heb.13:4 (Cremer, 666). (AS)
G1063	γάρ	gar	for	G:Conj	<b>γάρ</b>, <i>co-ordinating particle</i>, contr. of γε ἄρα, <b>verily then</b>, hence, <b>in truth, indeed, yea, then, why</b>, and when giving a reason or explanation, <b>for</b>, the usage in NT being in general accord with that of cl; 1) <b>explicative and epexegetic</b>: Mat.4:18 19:12, Mrk.1:16 5:42 16:4, Luk.11:3 o, Rom.7:1, 1Co.16:5, al. 2) <b>Conclusive, in questions, answers and exclamations</b>: Mat.9:5 27:23, Luk.9:25 22:27, Jhn.9:30, Act.8:31 16:37 19:35, Rom.15:26, 1Co.9:10, Php.1:18 (Ellic, in l.), 1Th.2:20, al. 3) <b>Causal</b>: Mat.1:21 2:2, 5, 6, 3:23, Mrk.1:22, 9:6, Luk.1:15, 18, Jhn.2:25, Act.2:25, Rom.1:9, 11, 1Co.11:5, Rev.1:3, al; giving the reason for a command or prohibition, Mat.2:20 3:9, Rom.13:11, Col.3:3, 1Th.4:3, al; where the cause is contained in an interrog. statement, Luk.22:27, Rom.3:3 4:3, 1Co.10:29; καὶ γάρ, <b>for also</b>, Mrk.10:45, Luk.6:32, 1Co.5:7, al. id. as in cl. = etenim, where the καί loses its connective force (Bl, §78, 6; Kühner 3, ii, 854f.), Mrk.14:70, Luk.1:66 22:37, 2Co.13:4. The proper place of γάρ is after the first word in a clause, but in poets it often comes third or fourth, and so in late prose: 2Co.1:19. Yet "not the number but the nature of the word after which it stands is the point to be noticed" (see Thayer, see word). (AS)
G1064	γαστήρ	gastēr	belly	G:N-F	<b>γαστήρͅ</b>, -τρός, ἡ, [in LXX for בֶּטֶן, ἐν γ. ἔχειν for הרה, ἐν γ. λαμβάνειν for חרה;] 1) <b>the belly</b>: metaph, <b>a glutton</b>, Tit.1:12. 2) <b>the womb</b>: ἐν γ. ἔχειν, <b>to be with child</b>, Mat.1:18, 23 " (LXX) 24:19, Mrk.13:17, Luk.21:23, 1Th.5:3, Rev.12:2; εν γ. συλλαμβ, <b>to conceive</b>, Luk.1:31. (AS)
G1065	γέ	ge	indeed	G:Part	<b>γε</b>, <i>enclitic postpositive particle</i>, rarer in κοινή than in cl, giving special prominence to the word to which it is attached, distinguishing it as the least or the most important (Thayer, see word), <b>indeed, at least, even</b> (but not always translatable into English); 1) <b>used alone</b>: Luk.11:8 18:5 Rom.8:32. 2) More freq. with other particles: αλλά γε, Luk.24:21, 1Co.9:2; ἄρα γε, Mat.7:20 17:26, Act.17:27; ἆρά γε, Act.8:30; εἴ γε (Rec. εἴγε), 2Co.5:3, Gal.3:4, Eph.3:2 4:21, Col.1:23 (see Meyer, Ellic, on Ga, Eph, ll. with; Lft, on Ga, Col, ll. with); εἰ δὲ μήγε, following an affirmation, Mat.6:1, Luk.10:6 13:9; a negation, Mat.9:17, Luk.5:36, 37 14:32, 2Co.11:16; καί γε (Rec. καίγε, cl. καὶ. γε), Luk.19:42 (WH om.), Act.2:18 17:27; καίτοιγε (L καίτοι γε, Tr. καί τοι γε), Jhn.4:2; μενοῦνγε (see see word); μήτι γε, see: μήτι; ὄφελόν, 1Co.4:8. (AS)
G1066	Γεδεών	Gedeōn	Gideon	N:N-M-P	<b>Γεδεών</b>, ὁ, indecl. in LXX and NT, in FlJ, <i>Ant.</i>, see 6, 3 and 4 -ῶνος (Heb. גִּדְעוֹן), <b>Gideon</b> (Jdg.6-8): Heb.11:32. (AS)
G1067	γέεννα	geenna	Gehenna	N:N--T	<b>γέεννα</b> (γέενα, Mrk.9:45, Rec.), -ης, ἡ (perh. through Aram. גֵּיהִנָּם, from Heb. גֵּי הִנֹּם, Neh.11:30; גֵּי בֶּן־הִנֹּם, Jhn.18:16; גֵּי בּנֵי־הִנֹּם, 4Ki.23:10; <i>valley of (the son, sons of) lamentation</i>); [in LXX the nearest approach to γ. is γαίεννα, Jos.18:16 (Γαὶ Ὀννόμ, A), elsewhere φάραγξ Ὀνόμ (Jos.15:8, al.), V. Swete on Mrk.9:43;] <b>Gehenna</b>, a valley W. and S. of Jerusalem, which as the site of fire-worship from the time of Ahaz, was desecrated by Josiah and became a dumping-place for the offal of the city. Later, the name was used as a symbol of the place of future punishment, as in NT: Mat.5:29; 10:28, Mrk.9:43, 45 47, Luk.12:5, Jas.3:6; γ. τ. πυρός, Mat.5:22 18:19, prob. with ref. to fires of Moloch (<i>DB</i>, ii, 119b); υἱὸς γεέννης, Mat.23:15; κρίσις γεέννης, 23:33. (AS)
G1068	Γεθσημανῆ	Gethsēmanē	Gethsemane	N:N--L	<b>Γεθσημασεί</b> (Rec. -νῆ, LTr. -νεῖ) indecl. (Heb. גֵּת שְׁמָנִי, <i>oil-press</i>), <b>Gethsemane</b>: called in Jhn.18:1 a κῆπος, but named only in Mat.26:36, Mrk.14:32. (AS)

G1072	γεμίζω	gemizō	to fill	G:V	<b>γεμίζω</b> (&lt; γέμω), [in LXX: Gen.45:17 (טען), 3Ma.5:47, 4Ma.3:14 *;] <b>to fill</b>; 1) <b>properly, of a ship </b>(Thuc, al.): Mrk.4:37 (pass.). 2) In late writers, generally (MGr, see Kennedy, <i>Sources</i>, 155), with accusative, before genitive, Mrk.15:36, Jhn.2:7 6:13, Rev.15:8; ἀπό, Luk.15:16, Rec. G1073	γέμω	gemō	be full	G:V	<b>γέμω</b> (used only in pres. and impf.), [in LXX for מלא, נשׂא;] <b>to be full</b>; 1) properly, of a ship (Xen.). 2) Generally (Plat, al.), (a) with genitive of thing(s): Mat.23:27, Luk.11:39, Rom.3:14 " (LXX), Rev.4:6, 8 5:8 15:7 17:3 (Rec.) 4 21:9 (b) before ἐκ: Mat.23:25; (with) with accusative of thing(s) (called a solecism in WM, 251; Bl, §36, 4), as in later Gk. from Byz. to Mod. times (Jannaris, <i>Gr.</i>, 1319): Rev.17:3. G1074	γενεά	genea	generation	G:N-F	<b>γενεά</b>, -ᾶς, ἡ (&lt; γίγνομαι), [in LXX chiefly for דּוֹר, דֹּר (Cremer, 148);] 1) <b>race, stock, family</b> (in NT, γέννημα, which see). 2) <b>generation</b>; (a) <b>of the contemporary members of a family</b>: pl, Mat.1:17 (cf. Gen.31:3, מוֹלֶדֶת); metaph, of those alike in character, in bad sense, Mat.17:17, Mrk.9:19, Luk.9:41 16:8, Act.2:40; (b) <b>of all the people of a given period</b>: Mat.24:34, Mrk.13:30, Luk.21:32, Php.2:15; pl, Luk.1:48; esp. of the Jewish people, Mat.11:16 12:39, 41 42, 45 16:4 23:36, Mrk.8:12, 38 Luk.7:31 11:29, 30-32, 50, 51 17:25, Act.13:36, Heb.3:10 " (LXX); τὴν γ. αὐτοῦ τίς διηγήσεται, Act.8:33 (LXX); (with) the period covered by the life-time of a generation, used loosely in pl. of successive ages: Act.14:16 15:21, Eph.3:5, Col.1:26; εἰς γενεὰς καὶ γ. (= לִדוֹר וָדוֹר, al.), Luk.34:17, al), Luk.1:50; εἰς πάσας τὰς γ. τοῦ αἰῶνος τῶν αἰώνων, Eph.3:21 (Ellic, in l; <i>DCG</i>, i, 639f.). (AS)
G1075	γενεαλογέω	genealogeō	to trace genealogy	G:V	<b>γενεαλογέω</b>, -ῶ (&lt; γενεά, λέγω), [in LXX: 1Ch.5:1 (יחשׁ)*;] <b>to trace ancestry, reckon genealogy</b>; pass, before ἐκ: Heb.7:6. (AS)
G1076	γενεαλογία	genealogia	genealogy	G:N-F	<b>γενεαλογία</b>, -ας, ἡ (see previous word); 1) <b>the making of a pedigree</b>. 2) <b>a genealogy</b>: pl, 1Ti.1:4, Tit.3:9 (see <i>CGT</i>, in l, and ib. <i>Intr.</i>, xlix ff; <i>DB</i>, ii, p. 141). (AS)
G1077	γενέσια, γενέθλιος	genesia, genethlios	birthday	G:N-N	<b>γενέσια</b>, -ων, τά, neut. pl. of adj. -ιος, -ον, relating to birth (&lt; γένεσις); 1) in Attic Gk, <b>a commemoration of the dead</b>. 2) In late Gk, <b>a birthday feast</b> (= cl. γενέθλια; so in π, see MM, <i>Exp.</i>, x; cf. also Ῥutherford, <i>NPhr.</i>, 184): Mat.14:6, Mrk.6:21. G1078	γένεσις	genesis	origin	G:N-F	<b>γένεσις</b>, -εως, ἡ (&lt; γίγνομαι), [in LXX chiefly for תּוֹלֵדֹת;] 1) <b>origin, lineage</b>: βίβλος γενέσεως (as in Gen.2:4 a 5:1), Mat.1:1. 2) <b>birth</b>: Mat.1:18, Luk.1:14 (Rec. γέννησις); πρόσωπον τῆς γ, <b>face of his birth</b> ("what God made him to be," Hort, in l.), Jas.1:23; ὁ τροχὸς τῆς γ, <b>the wheel (course) of birth</b> or <b>creation</b> ("the wheel of man's nature according to its original Divine purpose," Hort), Jas.3:6. G1080	γεννάω	gennaō	to beget	G:V	<b>γεννάω</b>, -ῶ (&lt; γέννα, poët. for γένος), [in LXX chiefly for ילד;] 1) of the father, <b>to beget</b>: with accusative, Mat.1:1-16, Act.7:8, 29; before ἐκ, Mat.1:3, 5, 6. 2) Of the mother, <b>to bring forth, bear</b>: Luk.1:13, 57 23:29, Jhn.16:21; εἰς δουλείαν, Gal.4:24. Pass. (1) <b>to be begotten</b>: Mat.1:20; (2) <b>to be born</b>: Mat.2:1, 4 19:12 26:24, Mrk.14:21, Luk.1:35, Jhn.3:4, Act.7:20, Rom.9:11, Heb.11:23; before εἰς, Jhn.16:21 18:37, 2Pe.2:12; ἐν, Act.2:8 22:3, (ἁμαρτίαις), Jhn.9:34; ἀπό, Heb.11:12 (WH, mg, ἐγεν-); ἐκ, Jhn.1:13 3:6 8:41; with adj, τυφλὸς γ, Jhn.9:2; [Ῥωμαῖος], Act.22:28; κατὰ σάρκα: κ. πνεῦμα: Gal.4:29. G1096	γίνομαι	ginomai	to be	G:V	<b>γίνομαι</b>, Ion. and κοινή for Att. γίγν- (M. <i>Pr.</i>, 47; Bl, §6, 8 Mayser, 166 f.), [in LXX chiefly for היה;] 1) of persons, things occurrences, <b>to come into being, be born, arise, come on</b>: Jhn.1:15 8:58, 1Co.15:37; with accusative and inf, Mrk.2:23, Luk.3:21, al; ὡς δὲ ἐγένετο, before τοῦ with inf, Act.10:25; with dative of person(s), <b>to befall one</b>: with inf, Act.20:16; with accusative and inf, Act.22:6; before ὡς, ὡσεί, Mat.10:25, Mrk.9:26; εἰς (M, <i>Pr.</i>, 71f.), Mrk.12:1 o, al; with genitive Rev.11:15; id, of age, Luk.2:42; with dative, γ. ἀνδρί ([LXX for הָיָה לְאִישׁ, Rut.1:12, al;] see Field, <i>Notes</i>, 156), Rom.7:3, 4; before ἐν, Act.22:17, Rev.1:10, al; ἐπάνω, Luk.19:19; μετά, with genitive, Mrk.16:[10], Act.9:19; before εἰς, ἐπί (Field, <i>Notes</i>, 135), κατά (ib, 62), with accusative of place, Act.20:16 21:35 27:7, al; before ἐκ, Mrk.9:7, Luk.3:22, 2Th.2:7, al. Aoristic pf. γέγονα (M, <i>Pr.</i>, 52, 145f; Field, <i>Notes</i>, 1f.), Mat.25:6, Luk.10:36, al. Aor. ἐγενήθη (for ἐγένετο, M, <i>Pr.</i>, 139f; Mayser, 379), Mat.11:23, al. (Cf. απο, δια, επι, παρα, συμ, παρα, προ.) (AS)
G1097	γινώσκω	ginōskō	to know	G:V	<b>γινώσκω</b> (= γιγν: see previous word. So also vulgar Attic, in Inscr, see Thumb, <i>MGV</i>, 207), [in LXX chiefly for ידע;] <b>to be taking in knowledge, come to know, recognize, perceive, understand</b>; in past tenses <b>to know, realize</b>; pass, <b>to become known</b>: with accusative, Mat.22:18, Mrk.5:43, Col.4:8, 1Th.3:5, al. Pass, Mat.10:26, Php.4:5, al; before ὅτι, Mat.21:45, Jhn.4:1, al; τί, Mat.6:3; ἀπό, Mrk.15:45; ὅ, Rom.7:15; τ. λεγόμενα, Luk.18:34; τ. θέλημα, Luk.12:47; τ. καρδίας, Luk.16:15; with accusative of person(s), of recognition by God, 1Co.8:3, Gal.4:9; by Christ, neg, Mat.7:23; freq. of the knowledge of divine things, of God and Christ; τ. θεόν, Rom.1:21 Gal.4:9; τ. πατέρα, Jhn.8:55; τ. κύριον, Heb.8:1 (LXX); νοῦν κυρίου, Rom.11:34; Χριστόν, Jhn.17:3, 1Jn.3:6; τὰ τοῦ πνεύματος, 1Co.2:14; τ. πνεύμα, 1Jn.4:6; τ. ἀλήθειαν, Jhn.8:32; of Christ's knowledge of the Father (ἐπιγ.), Mat.11:27 (Dalman, <i>Words</i>, 282ff.). In Hellenistic writers [LXX for Heb. ידע, Gal.4:1, al.], of sexual intercourse, <b>to know</b> carnally: Mat.1:25, Luk.1:34 (Cremer, 153). (AS)
G1098	γλεῦκος	gleukos	sweet wine	G:N-N	<b>γλεῦκος (-εος)</b>, -ους, τό, [in LXX for יַיִן, Job.32:19 *;] <b>must, sweet new wine</b> (Arist.): Act.2:13. (AS)
G1099	γλυκύς	glukus	sweet	G:A	<b>γλυκύς</b>, -εῖα, -ύ, [in LXX chiefly for מָתוֹק;] Jas.3:11, 12; opp. to πικρόν, ἁλυκόν, Rev.10:9, 10. (AS)
G1100	γλῶσσα	glōssa	tongue	G:N-F	<b>γλῶσσα</b>, -ης, ἡ, [in LXX chiefly for לָשׁוֹן;] 1) <b>the tongue</b>, as the organ of speech: Mrk.7:33, 35 Luk.1:64 16:24, Act.2:26 " (LXX), Rom.3:13 (LXX) 14:11 (LXX), 1Co.14:9, Php.2:11, Jas.1:26 3:5, 6 8, 1Pe.3:10 " (LXX), 1Jo.3:18, Rev.16:10; of a tongue-like object, Act.2:3. 2) <b>a tongue, language</b>: Act.2:11; joined with φυλή, λαός, ἔθνος, freq. in pl, Rev.5:9 7:9 10:11 11:9 13:7 14:6 17:15; λαλεῖν ἑτέραις γ, Act.2:4; γ. λαλεῖν καιναῖς, WH, txt. (RV, mg, omit καιναῖς), Mrk.16:17; λαλεῖν γλώσσαις, γλώσσῃ (see <i>ICC</i>, ll. with; <i>DB</i>, iv, 793ff.), Mrk.16:17, WH, txt, R, mg, Act.10:46 19:6, 1Co.12:30 13:1 14:2, 4-6, 13, 18, 23, 27, 39; γλῶσσαι (= λόγοι ἐν γλώσσῃ, 1Co.14:19), 1Co.13:8 14:22; γένη γλωσσῶν, 1Co.12:10, 28; προσεύχεσθαι γλώσσῃ, 1Co.14:14; γλῶσσαν ἔχειν, 1Co.14:26 (Cremer, 163, 679). (AS)
G1101	γλωσσόκομον	glōssokomon	moneybag	G:N-N	<b>γλωσσόκομον</b>, -ου, τό, vernac. form of cl. γλωσσοκομεῖον (&lt; γλῶσσα, κομέω), [in LXX for אָרוֹן, 2Ki.6:11, 2Ch.24:8, 10 11 *;] 1) = cl. -εῖον (see supr.), <b>a case</b> for holding the reeds or tongues of musical instruments. 2) As in LXX, π. (MM, see word), <b>a box, chest</b>: Jhn.12:6 13:29. (AS)
G1102	γναφεύς	gnapheus	one who bleaches	G:N-M	<b>γναφεύς</b>, -έως, ὁ, Ion. and κοινή form of Att. κναφεύς (&lt; κνάπτω, <b>to card</b> wool), [in LXX for כָּבַס, 4Ki.18:17, Isa.7:3 36:2 *;] <b>a fuller, cloth-dresser</b>: Mrk.9:3. (AS)
G1103	γνήσιος	gnēsios	genuine	G:A	<b>γνήσιος</b>, -α, -ον (&lt; γίγνομαι), [in LXX: Sir.7:18, 3Ma.3:19 *;] 1) prop, <b>lawfully begotten, born in wedlock</b> (in π, γυνὴ γ, <b>a lawful wife</b>; MM, see word). 2) <b>true, genuine, sincere</b>: Php.4:3, 1Ti.1:2, Tit.1:4; as subst, τὸ γ. = ἡ γνησιότης, <b>sincerity</b>, 2Co.8:8. G1104	γνησίως	gnēsiōs	genuinely	G:Adv	<b>γνησίως</b>, <i>adv.</i>, [in LXX: 2Ma.14:8, 3Ma.3:23 *;] <b>sincerely, honourably</b>: Phi 2:20 (for a parallel in π, see MM, see word). (AS)
G1105	γνόφος	gnophos	darkness	G:N-M	<b>γνόφος</b> (later form of δν-), [in LXX for אָפֵל, עֲרָפֶל, etc;] <b>darkness, gloom</b> (including "an element of tempest," Tr, <i>Syn.</i>, §with): Heb.12:18. (AS)
G1106	γνώμη	gnōmē	resolution	G:N-F	<b>γνώμη</b>, -ης, ἡ (&lt; γιγνώσκω), [in LXX: Da TH 2:15 (דָּת), Ps 82(83):3 (סוֹד), elsewhere, chiefly II Es, for טְעֵם;] 1) <b>a means of knowing, a token</b> (Theogn.). 2) In Attic writers, <b>the mind</b>, its operations and results (see Edwards, <i>Lex.</i>, <i>App.</i>, A); (a) <b>mind, understanding</b>; (b) <b>purpose, intention</b>: Act.20:3; (with) <b>judgment, opinion</b>: 1Co.1:10, Rev.17:13; (d) <b>counsel, advice</b>: 1Co.7:25, 40 2Co.8:10, Phm 14; (e) <b>royal purpose, decree</b> (as in Da, I and II Es): Rev.17:17 (Cremer, 671). (AS)
G1107	γνωρίζω	gnōrizō	to make known	G:V	<b>γνωρίζω</b> (&lt; γιγνώσκω), [in LXX chiefly for ידע hi;] 1) as most commonly in cl, <b>to come to know, discover, know</b>: Php.1:22 (but cf. R, mg.). 2) <b>to make known</b>: with accusative, Rom.9:22, 23; with accusative of thing(s) da.t. of person(s), Luk.2:15, Jhn.15:15 17:26, Act.2:28 " (LXX), 1Co.15:1, 2Co.8:1, Gal.1:11, Eph.1:9 6:19, 21 Col.4:7, 9 2Pe.1:16; with dative, before ὅτι, 1Co.12:3; before τί, Col.1:27; περί, Luk.2:17. G1108	γνῶσις	gnōsis	knowledge	G:N-F	<b>γνῶσις</b>, -εως, ἡ (&lt; γιγνώσκω), [in LXX chiefly for דַּעַת;] 1) <b>a seeking to know, inquiry, investigation</b>. 2) <b>knowledge</b>, in NT, specially of the kn. of spiritual truth: absol, Luk.11:52, Rom.2:20 15:14, 1Co.1:5 (Lft, <i>Notes</i>, 147) 8:1, 7, 10, 11, 13:2, 8 14:6, 2Co.6:6 8:7 11:6, Eph.3:19, Col.2:3, 1Pe.3:7, 2Pe.1:5, 6; with genitive obj, σωτηρίας, Luk.1:77; τ. δόξης τ. θεοῦ, 2Co.4:6; τ. θεοῦ, 2Co.2:14 10:5; Χριστοῦ Ἰησοῦ, Php.3:8 (see Deiss, <i>LAE</i>, 383.8), 2Pe.3:18; with genitive subjc, θεοῦ, Rom.11:33; λόγος γνώσεως, 1Co.12:8; ψευδωνύμου γνώσεως, 1Ti.6:20. G1115	Γολγοθᾶ	Golgotha	Golgotha	N:N--L	<b>Γολγοθά</b> (Rec. -θᾶ; WH, mg, Γολγόθ, Jo, l.with, Aram. גָּלְגָּלְתָּא = Heb. גֻּלְגֹּלֶת, LXX, κρανίον, Jdg.9:53, 2Ki.9:35); indecl. (exc. Mrk.15:22, -άν), <b>Golgotha</b>, the place of the crucifixion: Mat.27:33, Mrk.15:22, Jhn.19:17. (AS)

G1121	γράμμα	gramma	something written	G:N-N	<b>γράμμα</b>, -τος, τό (&lt; γράφω), [in LXX for סֵפֶר, etc;] 1) <b>that which is traced</b> or <b>drawn, a picture</b>. 2) <b>that which is written</b>; (1) <b>a character, letter</b>: Gal.6:11; (2) <b>a writing, a written document</b>; (a) <b>a bill</b> or <b>account</b>: Luk.16:6, 7; (b) <b>a letter</b>: Act.28:21; (with) τὰ ἱερὰ γ, <b>the sacred writings</b>, i.e. the OT: 2Ti.3:15 (so in Philo, <i>Vit. Mos.</i>, iii, 39); (d) τὸ γ, <b>the letter</b>, the written word as an external authority in contrast with the direct influence of the Spirit as manifested in the new Covenant: Rom.2:27, 29 7:6, 2Co.3:6, 7; (3) τὰ γ, <b>letters</b>, i.e. <b>learning</b>: Jhn.7:15, Act.26:24. (In π. an illiterate person is very frequently referred to as γράμματα μ᾽̀ εἰδότης, and this "never means anything else than inability to write": MM, <i>Exp.</i>, x; but see also Cremer, 166; <i>DCG</i>, i, 202; ii, 584.) (AS)
G1122	γραμματεύς	grammateus	scribe	G:N-M	<b>γραμματεύς</b>, -έως (accusative pl, -εῖς, see Bl, §8, 2), ὁ (&lt; γράμμα), [in LXX always for שׁטר in Hex, elsewhere chiefly for ספר;] 1) <b>a secretary</b>; γ. τ. πόλεως, <b>a state-clerk</b>: Act.19:35. 2) In π, of a military officer (Deiss, <i>BS</i>, 110f.). So Jdg.5:14, 4Ki.25:19 (ספר), al. 3) <b>a scribe, a biblical scholar, teacher of the law</b> (so first in I Est.8:3, II Est.7:6; in Luk.5:17, νομοδιδάσκαλος; in Luk.10:25, νομικός): Mat.7:29, Mrk.1:22, and freq. in Gosp. γ. καὶ ἀρχιερεῖς, Mat.2:4, and al; γ. κ. Φαρισαῖοι, Mat.5:20, and al; γ. μαθητευθεὶς τῇ βασιλείᾳ τ. οὐρ, Mat.13:52; ποῦ σοφός; ποῦ γ, 1Co.1:20 (Cremer, 167; <i>DB</i>, iv, 420, 800). (AS)

G1124	γραφή	graphē	a writing	G:N-F	<b>γραφή</b>, -ῆς, ἡ (&lt; γράφω), [in LXX chiefly for כְּתָב;] 1) <b>a drawing, painting</b>. 2) (a) <b>writing</b>; (b) <b>that which is written, a writing</b>: πᾶσα γ, 2Ti.3:16; γ. ἅγιαι, Rom.1:2; προφητικαί, Rom.16:26; al αἱ γ. τ. προφητῶν, Mat.26:56; ἡ γ, αἱ γ, <b>the sacred writings, the Scriptures</b> (i.e. the OT; see Milligan, <b>NTD</b>, 205); in pl, when the sacred writings as a whole are meant, e.g. Mat.21:42 26:54, Jhn.5:39, Rom.15:4; in sing, when a particular passage is referred to, as in Luk.4:21, Jhn.19:24, Rom.4:3 9:17 10:11 11:2, Jas.2:23 (Cremer, 165; <i>DCG</i>, ii, 584). G1125	γράφω	graphō	to write	G:V	<b>γράφω</b>, [in LXX chiefly for כּתב]; 1) <b>to scrape, graze</b> (Hom.), and later (Hdt.) <b>to sketch, draw</b>. 2) <b>to write</b>; (a) <b>of forming or tracing letters on writing material</b>: Jhn.8:[6], Gal.6:11, 2Th.3:17; (b) <b>to express in writing, commit to writing, record</b>: Luk.1:63, Jhn.19:21, 22 Rev.1:11, 19 al; of scripture as a standing authority (Deiss, <i>BS</i>, 112ff.), γέγραπται, <b>it stands written</b> (Luther), Mat.4:4, Mrk.7:6, Luk.4:8, Rom.1:17, 1Co.1:31, al; id. before ἐν, Mrk.1:2, Act.1:20, al; with accusative, <b>to write of</b>: Jhn.1:46, Rom.10:5; before περί, Mat.26:24, Mrk.14:21, Jhn.5:46; al; with dative (WM, §31, 4), Luk.18:31; id. before ἵνα (M, <i>Pr.</i>, 207f.), Mrk.12:19, Luk.20:28; κατὰ τ. γεγραμμένον, 2Co.4:13; γεγραμμένον ἐστί, Jhn.2:17; ἐγράφη, Rom.4:24; ἐπ᾽ αὐτῷ γεγραμμένα, Jhn.12:16; (with) of writing directions or information, with dative of person(s): Rom.15:15, 2Co.7:12, al; (d) <b>of that which contains the record or message</b>: βιβλίον, Mrk.10:4, Jhn.21:25, Rev.5:1; τίτλον, Jhn.19:19; ἐπιστολήν, Act.23:25; ἐντολήν, Mrk.10:5 (cf. ἀπο, ἐγ, ἐπι, κατα, προ-). G1131	γυμνός	gumnos	naked	G:A	<b>γυμνός</b>, -ή, -όν, [in LXX chiefly for עָרוֹם;] <b>naked, without clothing</b>, and sometimes (as freq. in cl.) <b>scantily</b> or <b>poorly clad</b> (Isa.20:2 ff, Tob.1:16, 2Ma.11:12): Mat.25:36, 38 43, 44, Mrk.14:52, Jhn.21:7, Act.19:16, Jas.2:15, Rev.3:17 16:15, 17:16; as subst, to γ, <b>the naked body</b>, Mrk.14:51. G1133	γυναικάριον	gunaikarion	weak-willed woman	G:N-N	<b>γυναικάριον</b>, -ου, τό (dim. of γυνή), <b>a little woman</b>; contemptuously, <b>a silly woman</b> (EV): 2Ti.3:6. (AS)

G1135	γυνή	gunē	woman	G:N-F	<b>γυνή</b>, -αικός, ἡ, [in LXX for אִשָּׁה;] 1) <b>a woman</b>, <b>married or unmarried</b>: Mat.11:11 14:21, al; ὕπανδρος γ, Rom.7:2; γ. χήρα, Luk.4:26; in vocat, γύναι implies neither reproof nor severity, but is used freq. as a term of respect and endearment, Mat.15:28, Jhn.2:4, 4:21 19:26. 2) <b>a wife</b>: Mat.1:20, 1Co.7:3, 4 al; γ. ἀπολύειν, Mrk.10:2, al; γ. ἔχειν Mrk.6:18; γ. λαβεῖν, Mrk.12:19; γ. γαμεῖν, Luk.14:20. 3) <b>a deaconess</b>, 1Ti.3:11 (<i>CGT</i>, in l.). (AS)

(Heb. דָּוִד), <b>David</b>, King of Israel: Mat.1:6; 12:3, and al; σκηνὴ Δ, Act.15:16; κλεὶς Δ, Rev.3:7; θρόνος Δ, Luk.1:32; ῥίζα Δ, Rev.5:5; βασιλεία Δ, Mrk.11:10; υἱὸς Δ, the Messiah (Ps. G1139	δαιμονίζομαι	daimonizomai	be demonised	G:V	<b>δαιμονίζομαι</b> (in cl. also δαιμονάω; &lt; δαίμων), [in Aq: Ps 90(91):6 *;] <b>to be under the power of a δαίμων </b> (δαιμόνιον, which see), <b>to be possessed</b>: Mat.15:22; elsewhere always ptcp, -ιζόμενος, -ισθείς: Mat.4:24; 8:16, 28, 33 9:32 12:22, Mrk.1:32 15 16 18, Luk.8:36, Jhn.10:21 (Cremer, 171). (AS)
G1140	δαιμόνιον	daimonion	demon	G:N-N	<b>δαιμόνιον</b>, -ου, τό (neut. of δαιμόνιος, -α, -ον, <i>divine</i>), [in LXX (so also in π; see MM, <i>Exp.</i>, x) for שֵׁד, אֱלִיל, (freq. in To);] 1) as in cl; (a) <b>the Divine power, Deity</b> (Hdt, Plat, al.); (b) <b>an inferior divinity, deity</b> or <b>demon</b> (as in magical π, Deiss, <i>BS</i>, 281; MM, <i>Exp.</i>, x): ξένα δ, Act.17:18. 2) (a) in OT, heathen deities, false gods (e.g. Deu.32:17, Psa.95 (96):5); (b) in NT, <b>evil spirits, demons</b>: θύουσιν δαιμονίοις, 1Co.10:20; διδασκαλίαι δαιμονίων, 1Ti.4:1; προσκυνεῖν τὰ δ, Rev.9:20; ἄρχων τῶν δ, Mat.9:34; especially (syn. with πνεῦμα ἀκάθαρτον) as operating upon and "possessing" (of. δαιμονίζομαι) men: Mat.11:18, and al; εἰσέρχεσθαι δ. εἰς, Luk.8:30; δ. ἔχειν, Luk.4:33; δ. ἐκβάλλειν, Mat.7:22 In the phrase πνεῦμα δαιμονίου ἀκαθάρτου, Luk.4:33, the wider cl. usage (1. <i>b</i>) is recognised, ἀκ. being elsewhere in NT, the epithet of πν, and δ. = πν. ἀκ. (see <i>ICC</i>, in l; Cremer, 168) (AS)

G1160	δαπάνη	dapanē	cost	G:N-F	<b>δαπάνη</b>, -ης, ἡ [in LXX: Est.6:4, 8 (נִפְקָא), Dan LXX Bel 1:21, al;] <b>expense, cost</b>: Luk.14:28. (AS)
G1161	δέ	de	then	G:Conj	<b>δέ</b> (before vowels δ᾽; on the general neglect of the elision in NT, see WH, <i>App.</i>, 146; Tdf, <i>Pr.</i>, 96), <i>post-positive conjunctive particle</i>; 1) copulative, <b>but, in the next place, and, now</b> (Abbott, <b>JG</b>, 104): Mat.1:2 ff, 2Co.6:15, 16, 2Pe.1:5-7; in repetition for emphasis, Rom.3:21, 22, 9:30, 1Co.2:6, Gal.2:2, Php.2:8; in transition to something new, Mat.1:18, 2:19, Luk.13:1, Jhn.7:14, Act.6:1, Rom.8:28, 1Co.7:1 8:1, al; in explanatory parenthesis or addition, Jhn.3:19, Rom.5:8, 1Co.1:12, Eph.2:4, 5:32, al; ὡς δέ, Jhn.2:9; καὶ. δέ, but also, Mat.10:18, Luk.1:76, Jhn.6:51, Rom.11:23, al; καὶ ἐὰν δέ, <b>yea even if</b>, Jhn.8:16. 2) Adversative, <b>but, on the other hand</b>, prop, answering to a foregoing μέν (which see), and distinguishing a word or clause from one preceding (in NT most freq. without μέν; Bl, §77, 12): ἐὰν δέ, Mat.6:14, 23, al; ἐγὼ (σὺ, etc.) δέ, Mat.5:22, 6:6, Mrk.8:29, al; ὁ δέ, αὐτὸς δέ, Mrk.1:45, Luk.4:40, al; after a negation, Mat.6:19, 20, Rom.3:4, 1Th.5:21, al. (AS)
G1162	δέησις	deēsis	prayer	G:N-F	<b>δέησις</b>, -εως, ἡ (&lt; δέομαι), [in LXX for תְּחִנָּה, רִנָּה, תְּפִלָּה, etc;] 1) <b>a wanting, need</b> (so Ps 21(22):25). 2) <b>an asking, entreaty, supplica­tion</b>; in NT always addressed to God: Luk.1:13, 2Co.1:11, Php.1:19, 2Ti.1:3, Jas.5:16, 1Pe.3:12 " (LXX); with νηστεῖαι, Luk.2:37; προσυνχή, -αί, Eph.6:18, Php.4:6, 1Ti.2:1 5:5; ἱκετηρίαι, Heb.5:7; προσκαρτέρησις, Eph.6:18; ἐντεύξεις, 1Ti.2:1; δ. ποιεῖσθαι (Deiss, <i>BS</i>, 250), Luk.5:33, Php.1:4 (pl.), 1Ti.2:1; before ὑπέρ, 2Co.9:14, Php.1:4; περί, Eph.6:18; πρός, Rom.10:1. G1163	δεῖ	dei	be necessary	G:V	<b>δεῖ </b> impersonal (δέω), [in LXX chiefly for infin. with לְ;] <b>one must, it is necessary</b>: with inf, Mat.26:54, Mrk.13:7, Act.5:29, al; with accusative and inf, Mat.16:21, Mrk.8:31, Jhn.3:7, Act.25:10, al; with ellipse of accusative, Mat.23:23; of accusative, and inf, Mrk.13:14, Rom.1:27 8:26; οὐ (μὴ) δεῖ (non licet), <b>ought not, must not</b>: Act.25:24, 2Ti.2:24; impf, ἔδει, of necessity or obligation in past time regarding a past event (Bl, § 63, 4), Mat.18:33, Luk.15:32, Jhn.4:4, Act.27:21, al; periphr, δέον ἐστίν (as in Attic, χρεών ἐστι = χρή, see: δέον), Act.19:36; id, with ellipse of ἐστίν, 1Pe.1:6 τὰ μὴ δέοντα (= ἃ οὐ δεῖ 1Ti.5:13. G1164	δεῖγμα	deigma	example	G:N-N	<b>δεῖγμα</b>, -τος, τό (&lt; δείκνυμι); 1) (cl.) <b>a thing shown, a specimen</b>. 2) = cl. παράδ- (cf. ὑπόδ, 2Pe.2:6), <b>an example</b> (a warning): Ju 7. (AS)
G1165	δειγματίζω	deigmatizō	to disgrace	G:V	<b>δειγματίζω</b> (&lt; δεῖγμα), a rare word (<i>ICC</i>, ll. with), <b>to make a show of, to expose</b>: Mat.1:19 (Rec. παραδ, which see), Col.2:15. (AS)

G1174	δεισιδαίμων	deisidaimōn	religious	G:A	<b>δεισι-δαίμων</b>, -ον (&lt; δείδω, to fear; δαίμων, <i>deity</i>) <b>reverent to the deity, religious</b>; compar. -μονεστέρους (AV, <i>too superstitious</i>, R, txt, <i>somewhat superstitious</i>, a sense in wh. the word is sometimes used; cf. G1175	δεισιδαιμονία	deisidaimonia	religion	G:N-F	<b>δεισιδαιμονία</b>, -ας, ἡ (&lt; δεισιδαίμων, which see); 1) <b>fear of the gods</b>; (a) <b>piety, religion</b>; (b) <b>superstition</b>. 2) Objectively, <b>a religion</b>: Act.25:19 (Cremer, 72, 682). (AS)

G1181	δεκάτη	dekatē	tenth	G:A	<b>δεκάτη</b>, -ης, ἡ prop. fem. (sc. μέρος) of δέκατος, -η, -ον, [in LXX for מַעֲשֵׂר: Gen.14:20, Neh.12:44, and al;] <b>a tenth part, a tithe</b>: Heb.7:2, 4; 8, 9 (for a curious inversion of the Biblical use, see MM, see word). (AS)
G1182	δέκατος	dekatos	tenth	G:A	<b>δέκατος</b>, -η, -ον (&lt; δέκα), [in LXX for מַעֲשֵׂר and cognate forms;] <b>tenth</b>: Jhn.1:40, Act.19:9 (WH, txt, RV omit), Rev.11:13; 21:20. (AS)
G1183	δεκατόω	dekatoō	to tithe	G:V	<b>δεκατόω</b>, -ῶ, = cl. -τεύω (&lt; δεκάτη), [in LXX: Neh.10:37 (38) (עשׂר pi.) *;] <b>to take tithe of</b>: with accusative of person(s), Heb.7:6; pass. <b>to pay tithe</b>: Heb.7:9. (AS)

G1222	δήπου	dēpou	surely	G:Part	<b>δή-που</b> (WH, δή που), <i>indef. adv.</i>, mostly in sense of <b>surely, of course, we know</b>: Heb.2:16 T (WH, δή που). (AS)
G1223	διά	dia	through/because of	G:Prep	<b>διά</b> (before a vowel δ᾽, exc. Rom.8:10, 2Co.5:7, and in (Proper name)s; Tdf, <i>Pr.</i>, 94), <i>prep. with genitive, accusative, as in cl; </i> 1) with genitive, <b>through</b>; (i) <b>of Place, after verbs of motion or action</b>: Mat.2:12 12:43, Mrk.2:23, Luk.4:30, Jhn.4:4, 2Co.11:33, al; σώζεσθαι (διας-) δ. πυρός, ὕδατος, 1Co.3:15, 1Pe.3:20; βλέπειν δ. ἐσόπτρου, 1Co.13:12; metaph, of a state or condition: Rom.14:20, 2Co.2:4 5:7, 10; δ. γράμματος, ἀκροβυστίας (Lft, <i>Notes</i>, 263, 279), Rom.2:27 4:11; δι ̓ὑπομενῆς, Rom.8:25. (ii) <b>Of Time</b>; (a) <b>during which</b>: Mat.26:61, Mrk.14:58, Luk.5:5; δ. παντὸς τοῦ ζῆν, Heb.2:15; δ. παντός (διαπαντός in Mrk.5:5, Luk.24:53), <b>always, continually</b>, Mat.18:10, Act.2:25 " (LXX) 10:2 24:16, Rom.11:10 " (LXX), 2Th.3:16, Heb.9:6 13:15. (b) <b>within which</b>: Act.1:3; δ. νυκτός, Act.5:19 16:9 17:10 23:31; (with) <b>after which </b>(Field, <i>Notes</i>, 20; Abbott, <i>JG</i>, 255f.): Mrk.2:1, Act.24:17, Gal.2:1. (iii) <b>Of the Means or Instrument</b>; (1) <b>of the efficient cause </b>(regarded also as the instrument): of God, Rom.11:36, 1Co.1:9, Gal.4:7, Heb.2:10 7:21; of Christ, Rom.1:8 5:1, 17, 1Co.15:21, 1Pe.4:11, al; δ. τ. ὑμῶν δεήσεως, Rom.1:12, 2Co.1:4, Gal.4:23, al; (2) <b>of the agent, instrument or means</b>; (a) with genitive of person(s), Mat.11:2, Luk.1:70, Jhn.1:17, Act.1:16, Rom.2:16, 1Co.1:21, Eph.1:5, Heb.2:14, Rev.1:1, al; ὑπὸ τ. κυρίου δ. τ. προφήτου (δ. τ. κυρίου, 1Th.4:2 (M, <i>Th.</i>, in l.); Lft, <i>Rev.</i>, 121f.), Mat.1:22 2:15, Rom.1:2; δ. ἐπιστολῆς ὡς δ. ἡμῶν (Field, <i>Notes</i>, 202), 2Th.2:2; δ. Σ. (<i>NTD</i>, 22), 1Pe.5:12; (b) with genitive of thing(s) (where often the simple dative is used in cl; Jannaris, <i>Gr.</i>, 375), Jhn.11:4, Act.5:12; δ. τ. πίστεως, Rom.3:30; δ. λόγου θεοῦ, 1Pe.1:23; δ. παραβολῆς, Luk.8:4; δουλεύειν δ. τ. ἀγάπης, Gal.5:13; δ. ἐπαγγελίας, Gal.3:18, 2) C. accusative; (i) rarely, as with genitive, <b>through</b> (Hom), δ. μέσον Σαμαρίας (ICC, in l; Bl, §42, 1; Robertson, <i>Gr.</i>, 581), Luk.17:11. (ii) <b>by reason of, because of, for the sake of</b>; (a) with accusative of person(s) (M, <i>Pr.</i>, 105), Mrk.2:27, Jhn.6:57 11:42, Rom.8:20; (b) with accusative of thing(s), δ. φθόνον, Mat.27:18, Mrk.15:10; δ. φόβον, Jhn.7:13 20:19; δ. ἀγάπην, Eph.2:4; δ. τοῦτο, freq, <b>for this cause, therefore</b>, Mat.6:25, Mrk.6:14, Luk.11:49, Jhn.6:65, al; id. before ὅτι, Jhn.5:16 10:17, al; δ. τί, <b>why</b>, Mat.9:11, 14 Mrk.2:18, Jhn.7:45, al; δ. τό, with inf, Mrk.5:4, Luk.9:7, Jas.4:2. 3) In composition, (1) <b>through</b>, as in διαβαίνω; (2) of separation, <b>asunder</b>, as in διασπάω; (3) of distribution, <b>abroad</b>, as in διαγγέλλω; (4) <b>of transition, as διαλλάσσω</b>; (5) of "perfective" action (M, <i>Pr.</i>, 112f, 115f.), as διαφύγω, διακαθαρίζω. (AS)
G1224	διαβαίνω	diabainō	to cross	G:V	<b>δια-βαίνω </b> [in LXX chiefly for עבר;] 1) <b>to make a stride</b>. 2) <b>to step across, cross over</b>; (a) trans: τ. θάλασσαι, Heb.11:29; (b) intrans: before εἰς, Act.16:9; πρός, Luk.16:26. (AS)
G1225	διαβάλλω	diaballō	to accuse	G:V	<b>δια-βάλλω </b> [in LXX: Dan LXX 3:8, Da TH 3:8; 6:24 (25) (אֲכַל קְרַץ), 2Ma.3:11, 4Ma.4:1 *;] 1) <b>to throw across</b>. 2) <b>To slander, defame, accuse falsely</b> or <b>maliciously</b>: Luk.16:1 (Cremer, 120). (AS)
G1226	διαβεβαιόω	diabebaioō	to insist	G:V	<b>δια-βεβαιόομαι</b>, -οῦμαι <b>to affirm confidently</b>: Tit.3:8; before περί, 1Ti.1:7 (Cremer, 140). (AS)
G1227	διαβλέπω	diablepō	to see clearly	G:V	<b>δια-βλέπω </b> 1) <b>to took straight before one</b>. 2) <b>to see clearly</b>: Mat.7:5, Mrk.8:25, Luk.6:42 (cf. διάβλεψις, Aq, Isa.61:1, for LXX ἀνάβ-). (AS)
G1228	διάβολος	diabolos	devilish/the Devil	G:A	<b>διάβολος</b>, -ον (&lt; διαβάλλω, which see) [in LXX for שָׂטָן (as Job.1:6), exc. Est.7:4 8:1 (צַר, צָרַר);] <b>slanderous, accusing falsely</b>. As subst, ὁ, ἡ, δ; (a) generally (of. Es, ll. with), <b>a slanderer, false accuser</b>: 1Ti.3:6, 7 (CGT, in l, but see infr.) 3:11, 2Ti.3:3, Tit.2:3; (b) <b>as chiefly in LXX, of Satan, the Accuser, the Devil</b>: Mat.4:1, 5, 8, 11 13:39 25:41, Luk.4:2, 3, 6, 13 8:12, Jhn.13:2, Act.10:38, Eph.4:27 6:11, 1Ti.3:6, 7 (but see supr.), 2Ti.2:26, Heb.2:14, Jas.4:7, 1Pe.5:8, Ju 9, Rev.2:10 12:9, 12 20:2, 10; εἶναι ἐκ τοῦ δ, Jhn.8:44, 1Jn.3:8; τέκνα τοῦ δ, 1Jn.3:10; υἱὸς, Act.13:10; metaph, of Judas, Jhn.6:70 (Cremer, 121; <i>DCG</i>, ii, 605). (AS)
G1229	διαγγέλλω	diaggellō	to proclaim	G:V	<b>δι-αγγέλω </b> [in LXX for ספר pi, etc;] <b>to publish abroad, proclaim</b>: with accusative, Luk.9:60, Act.21:26, Rom.9:17 " (LXX). (AS)
G1230	διαγίνομαι	diaginomai	to pass	G:V	<b>δια-γίνομαι</b> (Ion. and late Gk. for διαγίγν-), [in LXX, 2Ma.11:26 *;] 1) <b>to go through, to pass</b>, e.g. τ. νύκτα; absol, <b>to live</b>. 2) Of time, <b>to intervene, elapse</b>: ptcp, with ἡμερῶν τινῶν, Act.25:13; ἱκανοῦ χρόνου, ib. 27:9; τ. σαβάτου, Mrk.16:1. (AS)
G1231	διαγινώσκω	diaginōskō	to decide	G:V	<b>δια-γινώσκω</b> (see previous word), [in LXX chiefly for ידע, and cf. 2Ma.9:15;] 1) <b>to distinguish, ascertain exactly</b>: Act.23:15 2) As Athen. law-term, <b>to determine</b>: τὰ καθ᾽ ὑμᾶς, your case, Act.24:22 (Cremer, 673). (AS)

G1233	διάγνωσις	diagnōsis	decision	G:N-F	<b>διά-γνωσις</b>, -εως, ἡ (&lt; διαγιγνώσκω), [in LXX: Wis.3:18 *;] 1) <b>a distinguishing</b>, also as medical term. 2) As law-term (Lat. cognitio), <b>determination, decision</b>: Act.25:21 (Cremer, 674). (AS)
G1234	διαγογγύζω	diagogguzō	to murmur	G:V	<b>δια-γογγύζω </b> [in LXX chiefly for לין, לון, as Exo.16:2, and cf. Si 34(31):24;] of a number, <b>to murmur</b> or <b>mutter among themselves</b>: Luk.15:2 19:7. (AS)

G1237	διαδέχομαι	diadechomai	to receive in turn	G:V	<b>δια-δέχομαι </b> [in LXX for מִשְׁנֶה (Deiss, <i>BS</i>, 115), פַּרְבָּר;] <b>to receive through another, receive in turn</b>: Act.7:45 (RV, <i>in their turn</i>; see Field, <i>Notes</i>, 116). (AS)
G1238	διάδημα	diadēma	diadem	G:N-N	<b>διάδημα</b>, -τος, τό (&lt; διαδέω, <i>to bind round</i>), [in LXX for כֶּתֶר (as Est.1:11), etc;] the band round the τιάρα of a Persian king; <b>a diadem</b>, the badge of royalty: Rev.12:3 13:1 19:12. (AS)

G1242	διαθήκη	diathēkē	covenant	G:N-F	<b>διαθήκη</b>, -ης, ἡ (&lt; διατίθημι), [freq. in LXX, and nearly always for בְּרִית;] 1) as usually in cl, <b>a disposition, testament, will</b> (Plat, al.): Gal.3:15 (R, mg, but see Lft, in l.), Heb.9:16, 17 (R, txt; MM, <i>Exp.</i>, xi; Milligan, <i>NTD</i>, 75; Abbott, <i>Essays</i>, 107; Deiss, <i>LAE</i>, 341; but see infr.). 2) As in LXX (for בְּרִית) = cl. συνθήκη, <b>a convention, arrangement, covenant</b> (exc. in the disputed cases mentioned above, always between God and man, "perhaps with the feeling that the δια- compound was more suitable than the συν- for a covenant with God---συνθ. might suggest equal terms," MM, <i>Exp.</i>, l.with): Gal.3:15 (R, txt, but see supr, and cf. Thayer, see word), Heb.9:16, 17 (R, mg, Westc, in l; Hatch, <i>Essays</i>, 47; but see supr.), Mat.26:28, Mrk.14:24, Luk.1:72, Act.3:25 7:8, Rom.11:27 " (LXX), 2Co.3:14, Gal.3:17, Heb.7:22 8:6, ib. 9, 10" (LXX) 9:4, 15-17 20" (LXX) 10:16 (LXX), 29 12:24 13:20, Rev.11:19; καινὴ δ, Mat.26:28, and Mrk.14:24 (R, mg.), Luk.22:20, 1Co.11:25, 2Co.3:6, Heb.8:8 " (LXX) 9:15; pl. Rom.9:4, Gal.4:24, Eph.2:12. (AS)

G1249	διάκονος	diakonos	servant	G:N-B	<b>διάκονος</b>, -ου, ὁ, ἡ (derivation unknown), [in LXX for נַעַר, שָׁרַת pi: Est.6:3, 5, א B Est.1:10 2:2, Pro.10:4, 4Ma.9:17 *;] 1) in general, <b>a servant, attendant, minister</b>: Mat.20:26 22:13 23:11, Mrk.9:35 10:43, Jhn.2:5, 9, 1Co.3:5, Gal.2:17, Eph.6:21, Col.4:7; δ. θεοῦ, Rom.13:4, 2Co.6:4, 1Th.3:2; δ. G1259	διαλλάσσω	diallassō	be reconciled	G:V	<b>δι-αλλάσσω </b> [in LXX: 1Ki.29:4 (רָצָה hithp.), I Est.4:31, al;] 1) <b>to change, exchange</b>. 2) <b>to change enmity for friendship, to reconcile</b>: pass, with dative of person(s), Mat.5:24. "The word denotes mutual concession after mutual hostility, an idea absent from καταλλ," which see (Lft, <i>Notes</i>, 288; cf. Deiss, <i>LAE</i>, 178.15; Cremer, 91, 632). (AS)

G1263	διαμαρτύρομαι	diamarturomai	to testify solemnly	G:V	<b>δια-μαρτύρομαι</b>, depon, of Ionic origin, intensive of the simple μαρτύρομαι, which see, [in LXX chiefly for עוּד hi, usually with dative of person(s), Deu.4:26 8:19, 1Ki.8:9, al;] <b>solemnly to protest</b>: Luk.16:28, Act.2:40 8:25 10:42 18:5 20:21, 23, 24 23:11 28:23, 1Th.4:6, Heb.2:6; in adjuration, before ἐνώπιον τ. θεοῦ, 1Ti.5:21, 2Ti.2:14 4:1 (Cremer, 415). G1264	διαμάχομαι	diamachomai	to contend sharply	G:V	<b>δια-μάχομαι </b> [in LXX for לחם ni, Dan LXX 10:20; Sir.8:1, 3 38:28 51:19 *;] 1) <b>to struggle against</b>. 2) In argument, <b>to contend</b>: Act.23:9. (AS)
G1265	διαμένω	diamenō	to remain	G:V	<b>δια-μένω </b> [in LXX for עמד, etc;] <b>to remain, continue</b>: Luk.1:22 22:28, Gal.2:5, Heb.1:11 " (LXX), 2Pe.3:4. (AS)
G1266	διαμερίζω	diamerizō	to divide	G:V	<b>δια-μερίζω </b> [in LXX chiefly for חלק pi;] 1) <b>to distribute</b>: with dative of person(s), Act.2:45; before εἰς, Luk.22:17, pass, Act.2:3. Mid. <b>to distribute among themselves</b>: Mat.27:35, Mrk.15:24, Luk.23:34; with redundant ἑαυτοῖς, Jhn.19:24 (LXX) (see M, <i>Pr.</i>, 157). 2) <b>to divide, separate</b>: pass, before ἐπί, with accusative, Luk.11:17-18; ἐπί, with dative, Luk.12:52-53. (AS)
G1267	διαμερισμός	diamerismos	division	G:N-M	<b>δια-μερισμός</b>, -οῦ, ὁ (&lt; διαμερίζω), [in LXX: Eze.48:29 (מַחֲלֹקֶת), Mic.7:12 *;] <b>a division</b>: opp. to εἰρήνη, Luk.12:51. (AS)
G1268	διανέμω	dianemō	to spread	G:V	<b>δια-νέμω </b> [in LXX for חלק, Deu.29:25 *;] <b>to distribute, divide</b>: pass, <b>to be spread about</b>, Act.4:17. (AS)
G1269	διανεύω	dianeuō	to signify	G:V	<b>δια-νεύω </b> [in LXX: Ps 34(35):19 (קרץ), Sir.27:22 *;] <b>to wink at, nod to, beckon to</b>: Luk.1:22. (AS)
G1270	διανόημα	dianoēma	thought	G:N-N	<b>δια-νόημα</b>, -τος, τό (&lt; διανοέομαι, to think), [in LXX for מַחֲשָׁבָה, etc, Isa.55:9, al, freq. in Sir;] <b>a thought</b>: Luk.11:17. (AS)
G1271	διάνοια	dianoia	mind	G:N-F	<b>διάνοια</b>, -ας, ἡ [in LXX chiefly for לֵב, לֵבָב;] <b>the understanding, mind</b>: Luk.1:51, Eph.4:18, Col.1:21, 1Pe.1:13, 2Pe.3:1, 1Jn.5:20; pl, Eph.2:3; in quotations from LXX, Mat.22:37, Mrk.12:30, Luk.10:27, Heb.8:10 10:16 (Cremer, 79, 438). (AS)
G1272	διανοίγω	dianoigō	to open up	G:V	<b>δι-αν-οίγω </b> [in LXX for פֶּטֶר (Ex, Nu), פָּקַח, פָּתַח, etc;] <b>to open up completely, to open</b>: Luk.2:23 (LXX); pass, Mrk.7:34, Act.7:56. G1273	διανυκτερεύω	dianuktereuō	to spend the night	G:V	<b>δια-νυκτερεύω</b> (cf. διημερεύω, <i>to pass the day</i>) [in LXX: Job.2:9 *;] <b>to pass the night</b>: before ἐν τ. προσευχῆ, Luk.6:12. (AS)
G1274	διανύω	dianuō	to continue	G:V	<b>δι-ανύω </b> [in LXX: 2Ma.12:17 *;] 1) <b>to accomplish fully, finish, complete</b>: Act.21:7 (EV). 2) In late writers (Xen, al, Clem, I ad Cor, xxv, 3), <b>to continue</b>: Ac, l.with (Field, <i>Notes</i>, 134f.). (AS)
G1275	διαπαντός	diapantos	always	G:Adv	<b>δια-παντός</b>, see διά, with genitive <b>διά</b> (before a vowel δ᾽, exc. Rom.8:10, 2Co.5:7, and in (Proper name)s; Tdf, <i>Pr.</i>, 94), <i>prep. with genitive, accusative, as in cl; </i> 1) with genitive, <b>through</b>; (i) <b>of Place, after verbs of motion or action</b>: Mat.2:12 12:43, Mrk.2:23, Luk.4:30, Jhn.4:4, 2Co.11:33, al; σώζεσθαι (διας-) δ. πυρός, ὕδατος, 1Co.3:15, 1Pe.3:20; βλέπειν δ. ἐσόπτρου, 1Co.13:12; metaph, of a state or condition: Rom.14:20, 2Co.2:4 5:7, 10; δ. γράμματος, ἀκροβυστίας (Lft, <i>Notes</i>, 263, 279), Rom.2:27 4:11; δι ̓ὑπομενῆς, Rom.8:25. (ii) <b>Of Time</b>; (a) <b>during which</b>: Mat.26:61, Mrk.14:58, Luk.5:5; δ. παντὸς τοῦ ζῆν, Heb.2:15; δ. παντός (διαπαντός in Mrk.5:5, Luk.24:53), <b>always, continually</b>, Mat.18:10, Act.2:25 " (LXX) 10:2 24:16, Rom.11:10 " (LXX), 2Th.3:16, Heb.9:6 13:15. (b) <b>within which</b>: Act.1:3; δ. νυκτός, Act.5:19 16:9 17:10 23:31; (with) <b>after which </b>(Field, <i>Notes</i>, 20; Abbott, <i>JG</i>, 255f.): Mrk.2:1, Act.24:17, Gal.2:1. (iii) <b>Of the Means or Instrument</b>; (1) <b>of the efficient cause </b>(regarded also as the instrument): of God, Rom.11:36, 1Co.1:9, Gal.4:7, Heb.2:10 7:21; of Christ, Rom.1:8 5:1, 17, 1Co.15:21, 1Pe.4:11, al; δ. τ. ὑμῶν δεήσεως, Rom.1:12, 2Co.1:4, Gal.4:23, al; (2) <b>of the agent, instrument or means</b>; (a) with genitive of person(s), Mat.11:2, Luk.1:70, Jhn.1:17, Act.1:16, Rom.2:16, 1Co.1:21, Eph.1:5, Heb.2:14, Rev.1:1, al; ὑπὸ τ. κυρίου δ. τ. προφήτου (δ. τ. κυρίου, 1Th.4:2 (M, <i>Th.</i>, in l.); Lft, <i>Rev.</i>, 121f.), Mat.1:22 2:15, Rom.1:2; δ. ἐπιστολῆς ὡς δ. ἡμῶν (Field, <i>Notes</i>, 202), 2Th.2:2; δ. Σ. (<i>NTD</i>, 22), 1Pe.5:12; (b) with genitive of thing(s) (where often the simple dative is used in cl; Jannaris, <i>Gr.</i>, 375), Jhn.11:4, Act.5:12; δ. τ. πίστεως, Rom.3:30; δ. λόγου θεοῦ, 1Pe.1:23; δ. παραβολῆς, Luk.8:4; δουλεύειν δ. τ. ἀγάπης, Gal.5:13; δ. ἐπαγγελίας, Gal.3:18, 2) C. accusative; (i) rarely, as with genitive, <b>through</b> (Hom), δ. μέσον Σαμαρίας (ICC, in l; Bl, §42, 1; Robertson, <i>Gr.</i>, 581), Luk.17:11. (ii) <b>by reason of, because of, for the sake of</b>; (a) with accusative of person(s) (M, <i>Pr.</i>, 105), Mrk.2:27, Jhn.6:57 11:42, Rom.8:20; (b) with accusative of thing(s), δ. φθόνον, Mat.27:18, Mrk.15:10; δ. φόβον, Jhn.7:13 20:19; δ. ἀγάπην, Eph.2:4; δ. τοῦτο, freq, <b>for this cause, therefore</b>, Mat.6:25, Mrk.6:14, Luk.11:49, Jhn.6:65, al; id. before ὅτι, Jhn.5:16 10:17, al; δ. τί, <b>why</b>, Mat.9:11, 14 Mrk.2:18, Jhn.7:45, al; δ. τό, with inf, Mrk.5:4, Luk.9:7, Jas.4:2. 3) In composition, (1) <b>through</b>, as in διαβαίνω; (2) of separation, <b>asunder</b>, as in διασπάω; (3) of distribution, <b>abroad</b>, as in διαγγέλλω; (4) <b>of transition, as διαλλάσσω</b>; (5) of "perfective" action (M, <i>Pr.</i>, 112f, 115f.), as διαφύγω, διακαθαρίζω. (AS)

G1309	διαφεύγω	diapheugō	to escape	G:V	<b>δια-φεύγω </b> [in LXX: Jos.8:22 (פָּלִיט), Jos.10:28 (שָׂרִיד), etc;] <b>to flee through, escape</b>: Act.27:42. (AS)
G1310	διαφημίζω	diaphēmizō	to publish abroad	G:V	<b>δια-φημίζω </b> in late writers only, <b>to spread abroad</b>: τ. λόγον (= דָּבָר, <i>the matter</i>), Mrk.1:45, Mat.28:15; with accusative of person(s), <b>to spread abroad one's fame</b>: Mat.9:31. (AS)
G1311	διαφθείρω	diaphtheirō	to destroy	G:V	<b>δια-φθείρω </b> [in LXX chiefly for שָׁחַת hi;] 1) <b>to destroy utterly</b>: Luk.12:33, Rev.11:18; pass, <b>to be destroyed, disabled</b>: Rev.8:9, 2Co.4:16. 2) In moral sense, <b>to corrupt, deprave</b>: τ. γῆν, Rev.11:18; pass, διεφθαρμένοι τ. νοῦν, 1Ti.6:5. (AS)
G1312	διαφθορά	diaphthora	decay	G:N-F	<b>δια-φθορὰ</b>, -ᾶς, ἡ (&lt; διαφθείρω), [in LXX chiefly for שָׁחַת, and cogn. forms;] 1) <b>destruction</b>. 2) <b>corruption</b> (physical or moral): of the grave, Act.2:27 (LXX), Act.2:31 13:34-37. (AS)
G1313	διάφορος	diaphoros	different	G:A	<b>διά-φορος</b>, -ον (&lt; διαφέρω), [in LXX for שְׁנָא (Dan.7:7, 19); also as in Polyb, iv, 188, al, Τὸ δ, τὰ δ, <b>money</b>: Sir.27:1 42:5, 2Ma.3:6;] 1) <b>different</b>: Rom.12:6, Heb.9:10. 2) <b>excellent</b>: compar, -ώτερος, Heb.1:4 8:6. (AS)
G1314	διαφυλάσσω	diaphulassō	to protect	G:V	<b>δια-φυλάσσω </b> [in LXX chiefly for שָׁמַר (as Psa.91:11);] <b>to guard carefully</b> (M, <i>Pr.</i>, 116), <b>defend</b>: with accusative, Luk.4:10 (LXX). (AS)
G1315	διαχειρίζω	diacheirizō	to kill	G:V	<b>δια-χειρίζω</b> (&lt; χείρ), <b>to have in hand, conduct, manage</b>. Mid. (a) = act; (b) in late writers (Polyb, FlJ, al.), <b>to lay hands on, kill</b>: with accusative, Act.5:30 26:21. (AS)
G1316	διαχωρίζω	diachōrizō	be separated	G:V	<b>δια-χωρίζω </b> [in LXX: Gen.1:4 ff (בָּדַל hi.), Gen.13:9 ff. (פָּרַד ni.), etc;] <b>to separate entirely</b>. Mid, <b>to separate oneself, depart</b>: before ἀπό Luk.9:33. (AS)
G1317	διδακτικός	didaktikos	able to teach	G:A	<b>διδακτικός</b>, -ή, -όν (= cl. διδασκαλικός) <b>apt at teaching</b>: 1Ti.3:2, 2Ti.2:24. (AS)
G1318	διδακτός	didaktos	taught	G:A	<b>διδακτός</b>, -ή, -όν (&lt; διδάσκω), [in LXX: Isa.54:13 (לִמּוּד), 1Ma.4:7 *;] 1) <b>that can be taught</b>. 2) <b>taught</b>; with genitive, of source of teaching (in cl, poët. only); (a) <b>of persons</b>: δ. θεοῦ, Jhn.6:45 (LXX); (b) of things, λόγοις δ. πνεύματος, 1Co.2:13. G1319	διδασκαλία	didaskalia	teaching	G:N-F	<b>διδασκαλία</b>, -ας, ἡ (&lt; διδάσκω), [in LXX: Pro.2:17 (אַלּוּף), Isa.29:13 (לָמַד), Sir.24:33 39:8 *;] <b>teaching, instruction</b>, in both active and objective senses, most freq. the latter: Rom.12:7 15:4, Eph.4:14, 1Ti.4:6, 13, 16 5:17 6:1, 3, 2Ti.3:10 3:16, Tit.2:7, 10; ὑγιαινοῦσα δ, 1Ti.1:10, 2Ti.4:3, Tit.1:9 2:1; pl, δ. τ. ἀνθρώπων, Col.2:22; δ. δαιμονίων, 1Ti.4:1, δ. διδάσκειν, Mat.15:9, Mrk.7:7 " (LXX) (Cremer, 182). G1320	διδάσκαλος	didaskalos	teacher	G:N-M	<b>διδάσκαλος</b>, -ου, ὁ (&lt; διδάσκω), [in LXX: Est.6:1, 2Ma.1:10 *;] given as rendering of Heb. רַבִּי,רַבּוֺן (NT, Ῥαββεί, Ῥαββουνεί which see); <b>a teacher</b>: Jhn.1:39 20:16; of Jewish teachers, Luk.2:46, Jhn.3:10, cf. Rom.2:20-21; of John Baptist, Luk.3:12; of Jesus, Jhn.3:2, 10 8:4 11:28 13:13-14, and often in <i>Syn.</i>, most freq. in voc, as title of address, as Mat.8:19, Mrk.4:38; of Jesus by himself, Mat.23:8; of an apostle, 1Ti.2:7, 2Ti.1:11; of Christians, 1Co.12:28-29, Eph.4:11, Act.13:1, Jas.3:1; of false teachers, 2Ti.4:3 (Cremer, 181; <i>DB</i>, i, 609, iii, 294, iv, 691) (AS)
G1321	διδάσκω	didaskō	to teach	G:V	<b>διδάσκω</b> [in LXX chiefly for למד pl, also for ידע hi, ירה hi, etc;] <b>to teach</b> (i.e. <b>instruct</b>) a person, <b>teach</b> a thing; 1) trans: with accusative of person(s), Mat.5:2, Mrk.1:22, al; before ὅτι, Mrk.8:31; περί, 1Jn.2:27; with inf, Luk.11:1; with accusative of thing(s), Mrk.6:30 12:14; with cogn. accusative, Mat.15:9 (LXX); with dupl. accusative, Mrk.4:2, Jhn.14:26; pass, Gal.1:12, 2Th.2:15; with dative of person(s) (like Heb, cf. Job.21:23, but prob. a vernac. usage, see Swete, in l.), Rev.2:14. 2) Absol, <b>to teach, give instruction</b>: Mat.4:23, Mrk.1:21, and often in Gosp, Rom.12:7, 1Co.4:17, 1Ti.2:12, al. (AS)
G1322	διδαχή	didachē	teaching	G:N-F	<b>διδαχή</b>, -ῆς, ἡ (&lt; διδάσκω), [in LXX: Psa.60:1-12 title. G1323	δίδραχμος	didrachmos	two-drachma	G:N-N	<b>δίδραχμος</b>, -ον (&lt; δίς, δραχμή), <b>worth two drachmae</b>; τὸ δ.
